Unwind in front of the common room's TV or whip up a snack in the fully-equipped kitchen. Enjoy a glass of wine on the screened porch or take a quick walk down the street to some of Boston's best Thai food. neighborhood_overview: - The building is located in Union Village of Allston (part of Boston) and is near Brookline, Cambridge, Brighton and Newton. There is a garden and playground on the corner as well as a seasonal farmers market and the newly developed Boston Landing (3 min walk) and Commuter Rail (opening shortly) - Allston is a part of the City of Boston (not a suburb) It is famous for its hip, multi-ethnic, student and young professional population and its diversity. There are many local cultural stores and activities. Please do an online search of the area "Allston" or "Union Square, Allston" for much more info and ideas! - Convenient and walkable - Stop & Shop is a huge modern market with fresh produce, foreign/international foods and organics. It is a 2 minute walk from the house  - The subway, buses, Taxis, Car rental, Bike share station are all within a 8-10 minute walk from the house. -  Easy to get to BU, BC, Harvard, MIT Downtown Boston and Brookline - Great selection of bars and restaurants a
notes: - If you need to get in touch with me, please message me on airbnb or text/(SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) me on my cell # listed on the reservation information page.
transit: - 10-12 minute drive to downtown Boston, close to I-90 (subject to traffic changes) - Harvard Street T (subway) station is a few blocks away (8-10 minute walk) You can get to downtown Boston in around 20 minutes. Harvard Street T (subway) station - Green line B (Boston College) - Bus stops nearby-  57, 66, 64 and 501  - Hubway bicycle stations are close by - bike lanes all on Harvard Street - Multiple local Zipcars - Budget Car Rental and U-Save Car Rental are both close - Walking is a great way to get around with wide beautiful sidewalks along the whole length Harvard Street, Cambridge Street, Commonwealth Avenue
access: - The private first floor unit (with private front and rear entrances)  is all yours!
interaction: - I am close by and accessible via phone/text/email should you need anything for the house or any tips about Boston and getting around.
house_rules: - - Please be respectful and polite to neighbors. There are downstairs tenants so please don't be noisy after 11pm. - Please turn off any lights and adjust down the thermostat to 55 before you depart or please turn off the AC window units/fans - Return keys to lockbox at end of stay. (There is a fee of $50 for each set of lost keys) - No animals - No smoking in the house (there is a backyard area) - Check in is at 4:00 pm (message for special requests) - Check out is at 12 noon
host_about: Fun local Bostonite who can't wait to provide you with all the local tips!

name: Cozy 1-bd: Steps to 3 Major Train Lines!
summary: This 1 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment can comfortably accomodate up to 4 guests. A simple and functional space ideally located to take in everything Boston has to offer.  With close proximity to  to 3 major train lines getting to BC, BU, and downtown is a breeze!
space: The bedroom features a queen bed, made with clean linens prior to your arrival. Additionally, a queen air mattress can be set up in the living room to create a sleeping arrangement that best suits your group's needs. Please note that the living room has bifold doors that allow for privacy when the area is being used as a sleeping space.  When used as a common space, the living room is great to unwind after a day in the city. Ample seating, natural light, and a 60" curved LCD SmartTV provide a restful retreat.  The full size kitchen features stone surfaces, essential cookware, and modern amenities. Enjoy a home cooked meal, or spread out to get some work done in the custom built breakfast nook.  Other features include high speed internet, essential toiletry items, and  clean bath towels.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located on a quiet residential street just off Cleveland Circle. Groceries, restaurants, bars, and the scenic Chestnut Hill Reservoir are all within walking distance. The close proximity to three train lines puts the rest of the city at your fingertips.
notes: For those considering bringing a private vehicle, please note that this apartment does not include off-street parking. On street parking in the area is available, but can be tricky to navigate, particularly during the weekdays. From Monday to Friday, the vast majority of side streets only allow vehicles with a resident permit to park overnight. I am happy to share some insider recommendations for overnight parking, but cannot make guarantees.
transit: While the neighborhood offers plenty to do and see on foot, there are a variety of convenient and affordable transportation options available for those who are looking to venture out further. The apartment is located steps from the Reservoir, Cleveland Circle, and Chiswick Rd. green line train stops.  If public transport isn’t your thing, there are several private transportation options at your disposal. An Uber ride to almost anywhere in the Boston metro area should be around/under $10.
access: The entire apartment is for your group's exclusive enjoyment.
interaction: The entire apartment is exclusively for your enjoyment. However, should you need anything, we are always available via the messenger or by phone.
house_rules: - Check in is  any time after 3 pm - Check out is at 11 am - no Saturday check in/out

neighborhood_overview: Brighton is home of Boston University and Boston College students, young professionals, and families, Brighton offers numerous pubs and ethnic restaurants, with many affordable options for a leisurely afternoon or a night out on the town. Brighton also has 2 major hospitals, among these, we are less than a minute to Franciscan Children's Hospital. There are many restaurants, bakeries, pubs, and small businesses lining Washington Street, the tree-lined artery that runs through Brighton Center to Oak Square. BU Today has compiled a list of some of the best places to investigate, nosh, and shop when you visit!  If you have any questions of where you wish you go don't hesitate to ask us! We know the city and specially the tricks :)
notes: One night stay is available if the night is by itself!  For example: If Monday is not available, Tuesday is available, and Wednesday is not available, then feel free to book for Tuesday night! Contact us for more information or any questions!  If you are a light sleeper, subway passes in front of the building, so it could get a noisy.
transit: The T (subway) is 17 seconds aways from the apartment, yep we timed it! You can take the T from our place and go directly downtown in no time. You can find convenient stores within a 1 minute walk (great if you wish to cook with your family or friends).  You can aso find a few stores stores, bars, and a few restaurants. This is all within a walking distance!!!!
access: How to check in? You won't have to worry about us giving you the key because there's a lockbox with the apartment's key waiting for you by the entrance of the building. You'll be able to do a smooth check in and check out and won't have sweat about anybody giving you the keys! Are you driving? If so, parking is Boston is complicated but..... We've got you covered! We have one FREE parking spot waiting for you. You will receive a parking permit for this and super detailed instructions of how to park,
interaction: We respect your privacy and we won't bother you! But if you need us we are here 24/7 for you. We live a few blocks away :)
house_rules: 1.	Check in is after 3pm. Checkout is before 11am. Thanks for making this happen. 2.	No parties or events. $1,000 fee for breaking this rule. 3.	Treat our home with love. If our home is left in an exaggerated mess and extra cleaning fee will be charged 4.	Return parking permit when you check out. Lost parking permit fee $200 5.     No smoking. Smoking fee $200 6.     Guests from Massachusetts must be approved by us before booking our home.
host_about:
Raised in Boston and lived in many cities in the world. I love to travel and dogs. 

I am a publicist, love running at the Boston Common, and graduated from Boston University a few years ago!

I'll be more than happy to share any useful information or local tips with you!

neighborhood_overview: There are many trails within a short ride of Oak Square but my favorite is along the Charles River.  Whether you head West into Watertown or East into Downtown Boston, there are trails both on road and off road to enjoy. You should live in Oak Square if you don’t want to be woken up at 2 a.m by the sound of students yelling or beer bottles breaking. Oak Square is mainly comprised of working professionals and families.  This doesn’t make Oak Square a no fun zone by any means, it just means that you can have fun and still not get woken up when you have to be at work at 9 a.m.  Oak Square has lots of bars and restaurants, places to play billiards (The Last Drop) and darts (Castlebar) alike.  If you’re a foodie, the Lemon Chicken dish at Fiorelli’s express will make you feel both guilty and grateful at the same time, it’s tremendous. So there you have it.  Oak Square, with it’s humble beginnings has grown to become a top destination for twentysomethings who like access to the city lifestyl

neighborhood_overview: Allston is part of the city of Boston, situated southwest of downtown. The neighborhood is largely residential with a main road running one block north and a strip of restaurants, stores, and night life locations three block east.
notes: I have a pet hedgehog who stays in a cage in the living room.
transit: There is on-street parking for a car; however, parking can be difficult after dark as some streets nearby require residential stickers.  There is a Green Line stop one block north of the apartment along with multiple bus stops nearby. The area is walkable depending on where a guest is trying to get to. There is also quick response from Uber and Lyft.

neighborhood_overview: Allston is close to many colleges and universities in and around the City, the ethnicity of this part of Boston is huge! This mix of people makes Allston one of the most diverse neighborhoods in Boston. You can find ethnic restaurants and a lot of things to do around the apartment!. The variety of restaurants is very wide! Korean BBQ, Indian, Mexican, American, Italian, and even more. Is crazy how many different restaurants you can find.
notes: We like being transparent no matter what with our guests, therefore there are 2 important things you should know before you book with us. 1. Our studio is located on a main road. If you are a light sleeper please consider this before booking our cozy home.  2. Our studio is beautiful! However, the building needs fresh paint and since we do not own the building we cannot paint it. We don't want to give you a first bad impression. One night stay is available if the night is by itself! For example: If Monday is not available, Tuesday is available, and Wednesday is not available, then feel free to book for Tuesday night! Contact us for more information or any questions!
transit: You can take 7-9 minute walk to the subway and go downtown in less than 20 minutes! Also Boston University is very close, so you can easily get there taking the subway or the bus! The bus passes in front of the studio! Harvard School of Business is also very close. You can drive there in less than 6 minutes. If you plan to cook, there is a grocery store called Stop and Shop that is super close to the apartment, you can get there in less than 5 minutes!
access: You don't have to worry about getting the key from us, there's a lockbox with the apartment's key by the entrance of the building. You'll be able to do a smooth check in and check out and won't have sweat about anybody giving you the keys. Are you driving? We have one FREE parking spot waiting for you. You will receive a parking permit for this and super detailed instructions of how to park.
interaction: We respect your privacy and we won't bother you! But if you need us we are here 24/7 for you. We live a few blocks away :)
house_rules: 1.	Check in is after 3pm. Checkout is before 11am. Thanks for making this happen. 2.	No parties thank you 3.	Treat our home with love. If our home is left in an exaggerated mess and extra cleaning fee will be charged 4.	Return parking permit when you check out. Lost parking permit fee $200 5.     No smoking. Smoking fee $200 6.     Guests from Massachusetts must be approved by us before booking our home. 7.      Our home is located on a main road. We want to offer you a 5 star experience! If you are a light sleeper and this is something that would affect your experience please consider this before booking with us :)
host_about:
Raised in Boston and lived in many cities in the world. I love to travel and dogs. 

I am a publicist, love running at the Boston Common, and graduated from Boston University a few years ago!

I'll be more than happy to share any useful information or local tips with you!

Biggest room available in the cozy condo right down the street from all the exciting things to do in Brighton and extremely close to downtown Boston! There are many trails within a short ride of Oak Square but my favorite is along the Charles River.  Whether you head West into Watertown or East into Downtown Boston, there are trails both on road and off road to enjoy. You should live in Oak Square if you don’t want to be woken up at 2 a.m by the sound of students yelling or beer bottles breaking. Oak Square is mainly comprised of working professionals and families.  This doesn’t make Oak Square a no fun zone by any means, it just means that you can have fun and still not get woken up when you have to be at work at 9 a.m.  Oak Square has lots of bars and restaurants, places to play billiards (The Last Drop) and darts (Castlebar) alike.  If you’re a foodie, the Lemon Chicken dish at Fiorelli’s express will make

name: Your cozy, sunny retreat- just steps from T!
summary: The perfect little spot for a single traveler- safe, residential, and out of the way, but just moments from public transit, restaurants and bars, and a direct train ride to downtown.
space: Accessibility notes- I am on the second floor of an apartment with no elevator.
description: The perfect little spot for a single traveler- safe, residential, and out of the way, but just moments from public transit, restaurants and bars, and a direct train ride to downtown. Accessibility notes- I am on the second floor of an apartment with no elevator. In addition to your private room, you'll have a shared kitchen and bathroom with me. You'll have access to wifi, provided linens, and there is a coin-op laudromat and drycleaner just around the corner. I do not have a TV or air conditioning. I am very clean, quiet when needed, and respectful, and hope you are as well! In the summer I am home most of the time. I am equally happy staying out of your way, or dropping in for a chat, or even having a shared adventure-- it's really up to you. Brighton is a lovely mix of residential and business-- it is quite peaceful on my street, but very easy to access a vibrant restaurant and bar scene. I am out and about at all hours of the day and night and my street is very safe, but please use
neighborhood_overview: Brighton is a lovely mix of residential and business-- it is quite peaceful on my street, but very easy to access a vibrant restaurant and bar scene. I am out and about at all hours of the day and night and my street is very safe, but please use common sense! For your convenience, there is a Starbucks and CVS about a 7 minute walk away, along with plenty of independently owned shops, too.  I love the convenience of living in the city and with that comes city-style nights-- you will hear the train and street traffic, and it is never truly dark!
notes: I am rather allergic to fragrance-- so please, no strong perfumes, colognes, lotions, etc. I am a professional musician and occasionally teach hour-long music lessons in my home. If I have one scheduled during your stay, I will always let you know beforehand!
transit: I am just a few doors away from the MBTA Green Line, which can take you downtown past BU, or outbound to Boston College. There are bus connections nearby to Harvard Square, Watertown, and Mission Hill, which I am more than happy to help you with. (as for me, my preferred mode of transit is to walk)

I hope to meet you soon.

neighborhood_overview: Just beyond the bustling streets of Allston lies another, decidedly quieter and more residential neighborhood—Brighton. Home to many Boston University and Boston College students, young professionals, and families, Brighton offers numerous pubs and ethnic restaurants, with many affordable options for a leisurely afternoon or a night out on the town. First settled by Europeans in 1630, the area was originally part of Watertown. In 1634, the Massachusetts Bay Colony transferred the land to Newtowne (Cambridge today). The first permanent English settlement in what is now Brighton drew people from Cambridge, and the area became known as “Little Cambridge.” The moniker lasted until residents voted to secede from Cambridge in 1807, when the area was renamed for the English coastal city of Brighton and Hove. In 1874, Brighton officially became a neighborhood of the city of Boston. Throughout its nearly 400-year history, Brighton has seen many important developments. The Brighton Cattle Market
notes: NA
transit: Brick House Pizza & Grille 256 Washington St. Want to go gourmet? Brick House Pizza takes pride in its fresh dough and tomato sauce, made with fresh-chopped, vine-ripened tomatoes. Try one of the many specialty pizzas—the Hawaiian BBQ (barbecued chicken, bacon, and pineapple) or the Florentine (baby spinach, chopped garlic, and ricotta). Or choose your favorite ingredients to stuff a personalized calzone. Brick House also serves salads, subs, wraps, dinner specials, and burgers. A classic sirloin cheeseburger, salad, and choice of fries or onion rings is less than $6. On a nice day, you can sit at one of the eatery’s outdoor tables. The Green Briar 304 Washington St. This is no ordinary Irish pub: it’s as close to the real thing as you’ll find on this side of the Atlantic. If you follow international sports—particularly any of the Irish teams—this is the place for you. The pub broadcasts live Irish sporting events, including rugby, soccer, and hurling (find the current sports schedule

name: Your Home Away From Home
summary: Our beautiful 4 bedroom house is located in the desirable Brighton neighborhood in Boston; a vibrant area close to restaurants, bars & shopping. If you are looking for a great base for visiting Boston, then look no further!  This house was recently renovated, a 1910 home with modern living space and amenities.  We welcome people of all backgrounds into our home.  Most of the time, this is a shared space as we live here- but love nothing more than meeting new people, sharing our city and home!
space: We are only a 10 minute walk to the Brighton (Boston Landing) train stop, which can have you to Fenway in 5 minutes and downtown in less than 15 minutes, this also is a direct route to the other subway lines. We are a short 10 minute walk to Brighton Center. There are a number of bus lines right around us (57 to Kenmore; 64 Oak Sq-Central Sq; 86 Cleveland Cir-Sullivan Sq via Harvard Sq; 501 Downtown; 65 Kenmore via Brookline village) Fenway, Newbury Street, Copley, Back Bay, Prudential and Downtown Boston are all less than 4 miles away and offer numerous restaurants, bars, cafes and shopping.  You are also located steps away from the river for a jog or to rent canoes and kayaking.   This neighborhood has direct access along the main highway and Storrow Drive, which take you right downtown or provides easy access driving anywhere! An additional bonus is that this neighborhood is situated right between Cambridge, Historic Harvard Square, Newton and Brookline- a short bus ride to any of t
description: Our beautiful 4 bedroom house is located in the desirable Brighton neighborhood in Boston; a vibrant area close to restaurants, bars & shopping. If you are looking for a great base for visiting Boston, then look no further!  This house was recently renovated, a 1910 home with modern living space and amenities.  We welcome people of all backgrounds into our home.  Most of the time, this is a shared space as we live here- but love nothing more than meeting new people, sharing our city and home! We are only a 10 minute walk to the Brighton (Boston Landing) train stop, which can have you to Fenway in 5 minutes and downtown in less than 15 minutes, this also is a direct route to the other subway lines. We are a short 10 minute walk to Brighton Center. There are a number of bus lines right around us (57 to Kenmore; 64 Oak Sq-Central Sq; 86 Cleveland Cir-Sullivan Sq via Harvard Sq; 501 Downtown; 65 Kenmore via Brookline village) Fenway, Newbury Street, Copley, Back Bay, Prudential and Downtow
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood has a lot of charm, with lots to do and easy access to downtown.  We are steps away from the Charles River with plenty of outdoor activities including kayaking, biking, and strolling along the river.  There are parks and green space within a couple of blocks to walk to, play with dogs or kids.  The house is situated near to Brighton Center, plenty of cozy bars and restaurants; as well as the newly constructed Guest street which has a new flatbread pizza and bowling alley, coffee shop and ice skating at the Warrior arena.   Favorite restaurants in the Brighton area: The Stockyard, The Depot, The Bodega, Jim's Deli, Athans Bakery, Esperia Grill- plus many more
notes: *There is free street parking on a majority of our street. PLEASE READ STREET SIGNS. Currently, there are no resident parking only signs. Also, some days are street sweeping. The signs are clearly posted. *The house is connected to a deck and small yard/patio by a rear flight of stairs. * There is a possibility for extended stays, including that we are looking for an extended stay around the Christmas/New Years holiday 2017-2018 *Dogs with advanced special permission, not cats- please discuss with us *The pricing listed is based on access to the house with $40 for each additional guest. Discuss pricing for larger groups. * For large parties and house rental, there will be a $200 cleaning fee.  This is still common space so it is important to clean up after yourself.
transit: Options are endless: bike, public transportation, uber, and for an additional charge- can rent out our car as well.
access: During your stay, this is your home away from home! You will have access to the: 2 bedrooms for guests, most of the house and the back deck/yard space. There is a washer/dryer in the unit itself, but this is only for those on extended stays.  Normally, we will be living on site and so these will be shared living spaces, but depending on the number of individuals, you have your own rooms (2 bedrooms)!  And if arranged in advance or requirement for more guests, the whole house can be yours. There is free street parking all around the house.
interaction: We usually live in the unit and are always available by phone, text or email. You can contact us anytime if you have any questions about places to eat or visit or any concerns.   Since we are actually living in the unit, and it will be a shared space, of which we love to share and meet others! We are happy to share our home and information about the city we love! * During February stays, we will be renting out the whole house
house_rules: Quiet time after 10 pm.  You will need prior approval for pets and extra cleaning fees may apply.  No outside guests allowed back to the house.
host_about: We drink in life and its every experience.  Our favorite thing to do is experience new cultures, travel, and meet new people.

Just beyond the bustling streets of Allston lies another, decidedly quieter and more residential neighborhood—Brighton. Home to many Boston University and Boston College students, young professionals, and families, Brighton offers numerous pubs and ethnic restaurants, with many affordable options for a leisurely afternoon or a night out on the town. First settled by Europeans in 1630, the area was originally part of Watertown. In 1634, the Massachusetts Bay Colony transferred the land to Newtowne (Cambridge today). The first permanent English settlement in what is now Brighton drew people from Cambridge, and the area became known as “Little Cambridge.” The moniker lasted until residents voted to secede from Cambridge in 1807, when the area was renamed for the English coastal city of Brighton and Hove. In 1874, Brighton officially became a neighborhood of the city of Boston. Throughout its nearly 400-year history, Brighton ha

transit: Brick House Pizza & Grille 256 Washington St. Want to go gourmet? Brick House Pizza takes pride in its fresh dough and tomato sauce, made with fresh-chopped, vine-ripened tomatoes. Try one of the many specialty pizzas—the Hawaiian BBQ (barbecued chicken, bacon, and pineapple) or the Florentine (baby spinach, chopped garlic, and ricotta). Or choose your favorite ingredients to stuff a personalized calzone. Brick House also serves salads, subs, wraps, dinner specials, and burgers. A classic sirloin cheeseburger, salad, and choice of fries or onion rings is less than $6. On a nice day, you can sit at one of the eatery’s outdoor tables. The Green Briar 304 Washington St. This is no ordinary Irish pub: it’s as close to the real thing as you’ll find on this side of the Atlantic. If you follow international sports—particularly any of the Irish teams—this is the place for you. The pub broadcasts live Irish sporting events, including rugby, soccer, and hurling (find the current sports schedule

name: Studio Apartment with Kitchen 2 Min from T Stop
summary: This beautiful, Victorian property offers classic New England charm with comfortable, modern amenities. Enjoy this 1000 square feet apartment composed of a studio with a huge King size bed, a private en-suite bathroom, a work desk, a sitting area and a separate large kitchen. The house is a short, 2 minute walk from the Green C and D subway lines, for easy access to downtown Boston (3 miles away), Boston College (1 mile) and Boston University (2.5 miles). Parking is available for $20 p/n.
space: The apartment consists of a large bedroom, with a King-size bed, a large closet and an armoire. There is also a couch and a flat screen TV. In addition, a deluxe Queen-size air mattress is available, with a frame, so that it is not on the floor.  There is also a bathroom, with a tub, and a large kitchen with all the amenities you might need, including a table to enjoy breakfast, lunch or dinner. The apartment is inside a beautiful New England style Victorian house, in a quiet part of the Brighton neighborhood in Boston. Just 2 streets down, however, you will find Beacon Street, with multiple restaurants, bars, cafes... there is also a CVS and a supermarket, as well as a subway station close by.

neighborhood_overview: Brighton is a fantastic neighborhood filled with college students, young professionals and family households. This makes for a safe and entertaining environment, close to Boston College and Boston University.
notes: Please keep in mind that the second bed available is a Queen-size air mattress, with a frame, so that it does not lay directly on the floor. Also, please be sure to ask for parking beforehand, as it can be a tricky area to park on the street. We have on-sight parking spots available for $20 per night. In-house car service available.
transit: We have two subway (or "T") stops near us. Both the Green C and the Green D Lines are a short 5 minute walk from the house, making it super easy and convenient to get to and from the different colleges as well as downtown Boston. If you are looking to visit Harvard University, MIT, or the Cambridge/Somerville neighborhoods, bus 66 is only 10 minutes walking from us. A Zip car pick-up point is also right around the corner. On-sight parking is also available at a $20.00 per night fee.
access: Inside your bedroom, enjoy as much free tea or coffee as you want using a Keurig machine. There is also a microwave and a mini fridge at your disposal. On-sight parking is available at a $20.00 per night fee.
interaction: When we think about the ideal host, we believe that the less intrusive the better. After all, our goal is for you to feel like this is your home while in Boston. However, if you need us, we are always one phone call away.

host_about:
My name is ChiChi. Welcome to Boston, home my sweet home! 

I have a passion for travel and all types of outdoor activities. I love meeting new people from different cultural backgrounds, which offers me the chance to interact with some amazing minds/ideas and also makes me a positive, interesting, and thoughtful person. And I have been enjoying hosting guests from all over the world and help to make their stay in Boston memorable.

I am a working professional in my early 30th with a full-time job in a well-known bank in downtown Boston. In my spare time, I travel, yoga, dance, hike, read, blog, movie, and spend quality time with my friends. I am a good cook, infusing my recipes with inspirations from world traveling. 

I can speak English, Chinese, Korean and Spanish, and I am learning French!

notes: The place is very close to THREE green lines - B, C, D.  The Green Line “B-Train” is a great way to travel to and from the city. It is Boston’s oldest train line and covers many different stops along Commonwealth Avenue. It is an experience that I believe everyone should experience! There are a lot of stops, however. So, if you’re just looking for a more efficient way to get into the city, you might consider walking to Cleveland Circle and taking the “C-train”, or the “D-train”, or just order an Uber ($5-$10).

name: Boston Home Base: Cozy Two Bedroom
summary: Cozy, colorful first floor apartment sleeps up to four.  A great home base for your visit to Boston or Cambridge. Walkable to Harvard Square, Allston Village and parkland along the Charles.  Make yourself a cup of coffee, grill in the back yard or take a nap in the hammock.
space: A classic Allston home, built in the 1920s. My partner and I have been fixing it up over the last four years.
description: Cozy, colorful first floor apartment sleeps up to four.  A great home base for your visit to Boston or Cambridge. Walkable to Harvard Square, Allston Village and parkland along the Charles.  Make yourself a cup of coffee, grill in the back yard or take a nap in the hammock. A classic Allston home, built in the 1920s. My partner and I have been fixing it up over the last four years. Our home is the first floor of a two family house on a quiet street in Lower Allston.   Take a short walk into Allston Village for great restaurants and bars, (we recommend a margarita and some tacos at Lonestar) wake up and take a run along the Charles River, get some brunch at the Allston Breakfast Club. Minutes to the Harvard Business School, Harvard Square, and Boston University. Easy bike ride along the Charles into Boston or Cambridge. Close to the T. 1/2 mile to Boston Landing (Purple Line) 1 mile to Harvard Square (Red Line) and 1 mile to Harvard Ave. (Green Line). Hubway stations are close by. Stree
neighborhood_overview: Our home is the first floor of a two family house on a quiet street in Lower Allston.   Take a short walk into Allston Village for great restaurants and bars, (we recommend a margarita and some tacos at Lonestar) wake up and take a run along the Charles River, get some brunch at the Allston Breakfast Club. Minutes to the Harvard Business School, Harvard Square, and Boston University. Easy bike ride along the Charles into Boston or Cambridge.
notes: Street parking is available on many of the streets in the neighborhood from 4 pm - 8am (overnight) and all day on weekends and holidays. It is difficult to park in the neighborhood during week days between 8am-4pm because most parking is 2 hour parking during the day. Read the signs carefully before you park.
transit: Close to the T. 1/2 mile to Boston Landing (Purple Line) 1 mile to Harvard Square (Red Line) and 1 mile to Harvard Ave. (Green Line). Hubway stations are close by.

I'm on my way to becoming an architect (many exams to go!). We love Allston! We live in this apartment full time and rent it out when we are out of town a few weekends a year.

If you can't walk there, it's likely a short drive. I have an off-street parking spot for you should you need it. Room 1 has a queen bed, cable TV, comfy chairs, and closet space. If you're traveling with a partner/spouse, this is the room for you! If you need a second bed, Room 2 is a quiet room with full bed. Check-In is 3-7pm
space: Bedroom #1 is really my favorite room in the whole house! I've recently upgraded and updated it with a new queen bed, new paint, cable TV and furnishings. Bedroom #2 is available when there are more than two guests or there are two guests who need separate beds. Bedroom #2 is simply furnished with a full bed, nightstands, closet and small wardrobe. Both rooms are clean and comfortable, as is the small, private full bathroom.

Sometimes known as a neighborhood with lots of loud college students, my little corner of the neighborhood has few and I'm rarely bothered by outside noise.

access: You'll have access to both bedrooms (if more than 2 guests or 2 guests that don't co-sleep) and a private bathroom on the third floor. Access is limited to the third floor unless otherwise discussed. I will most likely be in the house when you are here, and while I'm generally a quiet person, it is an old house and you may hear me from time to time. But I'm respectful of people's space/privacy as I expect you are too. :)

host_about:
Hello!
I'm Gavin. I've lived in the Allston neighborhood of Boston for the better part of 20 years. I work as teacher and school administrator as well as being a traveling musician. I love this neighborhood and all its offerings. Need to walk to the hardware store? the grocery store? a ton of restaurants? a bar? a school? a hospital? It's all right here!
I have a lovely 3rd floor available with 2 rooms and private full bath (and an off-street parking spot!) for Airbnb guests. Hope to meet you soon!
G

name: Newly renovated 3 bedroom w/cable, wifi & parking
summary: Completely remodeled 1100+ square foot condo conveniently located near the Boston Landing Train Station with service to Fenway, Back Bay and Downtown Boston. This condo comes complete with all new furnishings, enjoy peaceful slumbers on your Gel Memory Foam mattresses, cook in your newly renovated kitchen with top quality Maytag appliances, rejuvenate in your spa-like bathroom with imported Italian tile.  Free on site parking available upon request at time of booking. Free cable and internet.
space: Architecturally, the building is considered a "3 Decker" which is a design most commonly found in New England. 3 Decker style buildings were constructed in Boston as tenement housing in the late 19th early 20th century and were mostly occupied by immigrants who worked in local factories, mills and shipyards. Over the last twenty years, however, many 3 Deckers have been converted to condos, the natural design is appealing to city dwellers who appreciate the high ceilings, bay windows and private outdoor space it affords its residents. 3 Deckers are also well known for each apartment having its own private deck off the rear of the building, one on top of the other.  Our guests have exclusive use of their own private deck.

neighborhood_overview: Supermarket, Liquor Store, Starbucks, Pharmacy, Restaurants and Retail, Bus Transportation, and Train to Downtown Boston are within 5-10 minute walk. Neighborhood is safe and well lit. 20 minute drive to Logan Airport. Also close to Harvard Business, New Balance, WGBH, Bruins and Celtics Training Facilities, Boston University and Boston College. Target, Home Depot, Best Buy, Marshalls, Home Goods less than a mile away.
notes: NA
transit: There is a Commuter Rail station within walking distance (Boston Landing). At the end of my street there is bus service to Harvard & Central Square. If you have a car getting to Downtown Boston or points north, south or west of Boston are easily accessed by either the Mass Pike or Storrow Drive. Logan Airport is an easy 20 minute ride.
access: Off-street parking is available for free, however it must be reserved at the time of booking. Unrestricted street parking is available all weekend.  Mon-Friday 8am-6pm there is a loosely enforced 2-hour restriction on street parking without a resident sticker.
interaction: We have someone on site who can help if needed.
house_rules: - No loud or excessive noise after 8PM
host_about: Kevin and Leigha live and work in Boston, Kevin is a lifelong resident of Boston.  Part of our business is property management so our properties are always well maintained and in the unlikely event a guest has an issue we are equipped to deal with whatever the issue is promptly and professionally.  We love our city and our neighborhood, we enjoy sharing our favorite places to eat and visit with guests. We enjoy traveling ourselves, our most recent adventures took us to Cuba and Ireland, as well as ski trips to Wyoming and Utah.

host_about:
I'm a traveling globetrotter, real estate professional, homeowner, mother of a toddler, and also a neat freak.

I have being renting through Airbnb for 1.5 years, and really enjoyed hosting people from all walks of life. And I profoundly appreciate the extra income I was able to generate to pay for childcare. 

What differentiate me and other hosts on airbnb is: I truly care about a guest's experience especially when it comes to cleanliness and how easy it is to check in/out. I only use pure white linens and towels, and only hire the priciest/best cleaning crew in town. 

My units are priced 20% lower than other Airbnb's in the area, and at least 50% lower than surrounding hotels. Please be considerate when using AC and leave the apartment in a manageable condition to help me keep the cost low.

name: Cozy bedroom near Harvard
summary: Great family home. It is a spacious one bedroom with a king size bed.  The bed is a pillow top individual wrapped coil springs.  Room  has a flat curved screen to enjoy a movie or just Netflix.  Room also has an antique sofa to have a seat or you you like to tilt the tv, you can watch tv form the sofa instead of the bed.  Room also has a desk where you can do school work or work.  Room. has a ceiling fan and and ac unit.
space: You will have access to the restroom and kitchen which are shared with family members who live in the Home or other Airbnb guests. The kitchen is small and the restroom has a stand up shower.  The shower doors are glass and you can adjust the pressure of the water beneath the turn knob. Room is located on the second floor.  You do have to climb a few steps.  I can leave keys for you in the mailbox in an envelope with your name on it with listed instructions to getting in.  You can check in any time after 11:00 am.  I usually send a message a day before just so I can see how much time I have to have your space ready for guests.

notes: NA
transit: You can park in the drive way and take the mbta bus.  The 86 and the 66 are the ones I usually take.
access: You will have access to the front porch, restroom, kitchen, and laundry room. The second floor doesn’t have a living room but the bedroom is spacious and does have a medium size sofa.  There is still plenty walk space in the bedroom.
interaction: My availability is flexible. I am always on top of my guests messages.
house_rules: If you use the kitchen please clean up after yourself.  Rinse your dirty dishes and place them in the dishwasher and make sure all doors are locked.  Please throw trash in the trash bins in the kitchen or room.
host_about: I am a student that attends Harvard night school. I enjoy movies and I like to ride my bike along Charles river when the weather is nice. My favorite color is lavender. I graduate hopefully next year. I am currently an undergrad student trying to get a Bach of liberal arts degree with a social science minor. I chose social science just because there is variety. I hope to meet you soon.

name: 3 BR, 2 baths, 2 parking in Brighton, Boston, MA

space: NA
description: First floor unit with open floor plan, modern kitchen, 3 bedrooms, 2 full baths and two parking in tandem in a 2-family house.  It is located in Oak square, Brighton, Boston. This unit is about 1 mile from Boston College (3 minutes driving, 15 minutes walking).  1 miles from the Green line subway.  Bus 64, bus 57, bus 501 and bus 503 are right at the corner. Bus 64 (At Faneuil st): From  Kendall Sq to Oak Square. Bus 57 (At Washington st):  From Watertown Yard to  Kenmore square. Bus 501 (At Washington st): From Downtown to Brighton center. Bus 503 (At Washington st): From Copley Square to Brighton center Washer/Dryer locate in the basement.

space: Guests have open range of the entire apartment.  Feel free to pick up groceries and cook in the kitchen.

Unit is conveniently located to Cambridge and Boston, and walking distance to many shops, restaurants and a vibrant nightlife.  Very easy access to BC, BU and Harvard. Guests have open range of the entire apartment.  Feel free to pick up groceries and cook in the kitchen. Guests can always text me with any questions or need recommendations. The apartment is on Cambridge St in Allston.  Walking distance to an incredible variety of restaurants and nightlife.  There is also a pharmacy open til midnight a block away for any last minute items needed. A major advantage of this unit is its proximity to public transportation. Located in Brighton, you're close to Boston College, the Chestnut Hill Reservoir, and just a quick T ride to downtown.
space: NA
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the lovely decor with beautiful pops of color, spacious bedrooms with comfortable King and Queen-size beds, and incredible fully-equipped kitchen with modern appliances. Located in Brighton, you're close to Boston College, the Chestnut Hill Reservoir, and just a quick T ride to downtown. Our beautiful Brighton, also known as “Little Cambridge,” is nestled just outside the city and is surrounded with local bars and restaurants, like The Green Briar and Brighton Bodega. This neighborhood has a quaint community feel and is in a perfect location for campus visits to Boston College or Boston University. You can even head to Brookline for an indie and art-house film at Coolidge Corner Cinema. This Sonder is a 2nd floor walk-up with stair access only, and no elevator. Due to new development, you may encounter some construction that will be audible from your Sonder.

house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

summary: Perfect for a family, group of friends or couple. Close to restaurants, bars and famous Allston Rock Concerts. All major Cambridge and Boston attractions are within a 10 minute drive of the apartment. Be close to Everything in this gorgeous apartment. There is an Elevator in the building, Floor to Ceiling Windows, Bicycle Room, and Community Lounge. The apartment features Stainless Steel Appliances, Quartz countertops, High Speed Internet, Laundry in Unit, and Garage Parking.
space: Great for students or people visiting schools nearby because of location! Also, tons of restauratnts, convenient stores and things to do nearby. 5 minute walk to multiple green line T stations for access to Downtown and Back Bay in minutes. Parking available at additional cost.

name: 2BR Place to Crash in Brighton
summary: Two-bedroom, one bathroom, small kitchen basement apartment. Totally separate from the rest of the house, a ten minute walk from the new Boston Landing commuter rail stop. Great spot for a weekend away in Boston, or just to crash for a business trip or something. It's a basement so the ceilings are a bit low and you might hear the upstairs neighbors from time to time. Nothing fancy here, but cheap and easy!
space: Keypad lock so no human interaction necessary!
description: Two-bedroom, one bathroom, small kitchen basement apartment. Totally separate from the rest of the house, a ten minute walk from the new Boston Landing commuter rail stop. Great spot for a weekend away in Boston, or just to crash for a business trip or something. It's a basement so the ceilings are a bit low and you might hear the upstairs neighbors from time to time. Nothing fancy here, but cheap and easy! Keypad lock so no human interaction necessary! You have the entire basement apartment! Keypad lock means you can just let yourself in and make yourself comfortable. I live in the upstairs apartment, so if you need anything just message me and I should be able to help out pretty quickly! Nice, quiet neighborhood. Parking is free nights and weekends, but is 2 hour parking without an Allston/Brighton permit from 8am-6pm weekdays. There is free parking not too far that never requires a permit, on North Beacon and Market Street. Just please pay attention to the signs because there is occ
neighborhood_overview: Nice, quiet neighborhood. Parking is free nights and weekends, but is 2 hour parking without an Allston/Brighton permit from 8am-6pm weekdays. There is free parking not too far that never requires a permit, on North Beacon and Market Street. Just please pay attention to the signs because there is occasional street cleaning. Boston parking is simply difficult. Nights and weekends are totally free though right outside the house in the street!
notes: The place isn't well decorated and there's not much to do inside, but I think you'll find it has everything you need. The dryer could be a bit noisy for one of the bedrooms, but the other bedroom is far enough away where it's nice and quiet. The couch in the living room pulls out into a twin sized bed.
transit: Buses are available and the commuter rail will bring you to downtown in about twenty minutes.
access: You have the entire basement apartment!
interaction: Keypad lock means you can just let yourself in and make yourself comfortable. I live in the upstairs apartment, so if you need anything just message me and I should be able to help out pretty quickly!

name: Comfortable Studio 1 Minute Walk from Green Line
summary: This beautiful, Victorian property offers classic New England charm with comfortable, modern amenities. Enjoy this spacious studio with a huge King size bed, a private en-suite bathroom, a work desk and sitting area, a microwave, toaster, iron, ice & coffee machines, and cable TV. The house is a short, 2 minute walk from the Green C and D subway lines, for easy access to downtown Boston (3 miles away), Boston College (1 mile) and Boston University (2.5 miles). Parking is available for $20 p/n.

name: Clean, spacious condo just steps from the MBTA
summary: Perfect location for your Boston vacation or for those looking for a short term stay as a student, professional, or visiting family in the area.  Located in a great area just 0.2 miles from the Green MBTA B Line, which will take you right to Fenway Park (3.4 mi) or Downtown Boston.  The condo is 1.5 mi to Boston College, 3 mi from Longwood Medical area.   Located on the top floor of a beautiful, fully renovated Victorian home.  Central heat and air!  Located on a very safe street in Brighton.
space: This rental is ideal for 1-4 guests.
description: Perfect location for your Boston vacation or for those looking for a short term stay as a student, professional, or visiting family in the area.  Located in a great area just 0.2 miles from the Green MBTA B Line, which will take you right to Fenway Park (3.4 mi) or Downtown Boston.  The condo is 1.5 mi to Boston College, 3 mi from Longwood Medical area.   Located on the top floor of a beautiful, fully renovated Victorian home.  Central heat and air!  Located on a very safe street in Brighton. This rental is ideal for 1-4 guests. Guests will have access to the entire 3rd floor of the house, which is a private 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment. We live in the house below the unit so are there if you need us.  Otherwise, we'll leave you to enjoy your stay! We do have a baby and ask that all guests adhere to our quiet hours as she is sleeping below!   If you plan on having late nights, unfortunately our place is not for you. Brighton is a great neighborhood.  Shops, restaurants, bars, coffee
neighborhood_overview: Brighton is a great neighborhood.  Shops, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, bakeries, orange theory fitness and a grocery store are all within walking distance.  If you are a runner, we are just a 1/2 mile from the Chestnut Hill Reservior.  Our unit is conviently located near several MBTA bus lines as well as MBTA Green line.  You are close enough to the city without the hassle of parking or late night noise.  It's a very friendly and safe neighborhood.
notes: Off-street parking available for one car in our driveway.  Please note that we are in the Boston city limits and parking on the streets is primarily for residents.  There is extremely limited non-resident parking and it is difficult to find a spot if you have additional cars.  We are only able to offer parking in our driveway for one car. We do have a baby and ask that all guests adhere to our quiet hours as she is sleeping below!   If you plan on having late nights, unfortunately our place is not for you.
transit: 4 minute walk to the MBTA Green B Line (to downtown Boston).  6 minute walk to the #65 bus that goes to Longwood Medical Area.  10 minute walk to Brighton Center (restaurants/bars).  5 minute walk to #86 bus (Harvard Square or New Balance Headquarters) or the #501 Express Downtown (Boston).
access: Guests will have access to the entire 3rd floor of the house, which is a private 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment.
interaction: We live in the house below the unit so are there if you need us.  Otherwise, we'll leave you to enjoy your stay! We do have a baby and ask that all guests adhere to our quiet hours as she is sleeping below!   If you plan on having late nights, unfortunately our place is not for you.
house_rules: - Quiet hours 9pm-8am.  We have a small baby sleeping below the unit so we ask that you do adhere to our quiet hours.  If you plan on having late nights, unfortunately our place is not for you.  Please reach out if you have specific questions.

name: Cozy, spacious apartment near Harvard, BU
summary: This is a lovely 3 floor townhouse with a large basement in the center of Allston/Brighton.  The room is one of the two second-floor bedrooms and it's very spacious and cozy.  Hardwood floors throughout living room and carpets throughout all other space. The room has a big wardrobe and a king bed.  It's 5 -minutes walk to the T Station and 15 minutes drive to downtown Boston, 8 minutes walk to the Stop&Shop and 15 minutes walk to the Chinese supermarket. It has a lot of resturatants around.
space: This is a newly renovated big house in a quite neighbourhood. It's 5 minutes walk to the public transportation and around $6 uber ride to downtown Boston. It's most suitable for people who travel here, study here for a short time and enjoy a cozy home.

name: Private, Cozy & Sunny Room by the metro
summary: A cozy and beautiful room with futon and a desk. Suitable for 1 or 2 travelers and right in front of the Green Line in Brighton, Boston. Fast internet connection and full access to common bathroom and kitchen. Room gets a lot of sun for a few hours during the day and has central heating so you'll never be cold while staying with us. You have a closet with hangers and there's an iron that you can borrow. Check in time is 6pm.
space: Our place is on the ground floor. There is an outdoor stairway and it consists of 27 steps as you can see from the pictures.    The place is shared by 3 people. All of us work and you probably won't catch us all at the same time. The bathroom is clean and is only shared by 2 people in the apartment as one of the rooms has its own private bathroom. You will be sleeping on the futon that you see in the pictures. It's a futon that opens up not a bed but it's comfy and does the job! we'll have it ready as a bed with clean sheets and blankets. As you can see in the pictures when the Futon is open you'll get more space to sleep on. Its length is a little bit over 6 feet. The size of it is a few inches smaller than a queen size but it sleeps 2. Important: The room has no TV and smoking is only allowed outside the house :) Side note: check in time is 3pm

If you look up the area on the map you'll see how nice it is! Not too far from us are a bunch of restaurants. And the Chestnut hill reservoir right down the road!
notes: We're chill and relaxed. The only thing we ask is that you clean after yourself and not be loud. Check in time: 6pm - Check out time: 12pm If we are able to clean the room and get it ready before 6 I will let you know for sure.
transit: You're in luck! Our building is right in front of the Green line (B train). If you have a car there's street parking right in front of the building. Or, you can par in the street next to us and walk back. Street parking is never guaranteed like anywhere else. But it's free.
access: We have lots of kitchen appliances that you can use. You only have to wash them and put them back when you use them. The only private area is your room. There's a big mirror in the hallway and a small porch if you're a smoker.
interaction: I will probably be available on spot to help you out with settling in. If not, my flatmate will. We're both friendly and welcoming. So you don't have to worry you're our guest and making you comfortable is a top priority.
house_rules: - Smoking only outside the house - No strict rules, we're chill - Fridge is off limits
host_about: Super easy going guy. Clean and quiet. Been living in San Antonio, Texas but moved to Brighton, Massachusetts a few months ago. I like meeting new people and I'm kinda funny

name: Spacious 1 BR. Apt. in Allston - all to yourself!
summary: Our apartment is in the heart of Allston, close to BU, Harvard, and MIT. You'll have the entire space to yourself, and we're happy to provide recommendations for food and fun nearby. Mikaela and I can't wait to host you!
space: Features of our listing include: One full-size bed and full-size futon (sheets provided for both); Hardwood floors throughout; Apartment faces away from the street, minimizing noise; Coin-operated laundry in building; Furnace heating in every room, including bathroom; Fully stocked kitchen, including pots/pans/blender/dishes/silverware; Street parking available; No TV or dishwasher
description: Our apartment is in the heart of Allston, close to BU, Harvard, and MIT. You'll have the entire space to yourself, and we're happy to provide recommendations for food and fun nearby. Mikaela and I can't wait to host you! Features of our listing include: One full-size bed and full-size futon (sheets provided for both); Hardwood floors throughout; Apartment faces away from the street, minimizing noise; Coin-operated laundry in building; Furnace heating in every room, including bathroom; Fully stocked kitchen, including pots/pans/blender/dishes/silverware; Street parking available; No TV or dishwasher You'll have private access to the entire apartment. The Boston Globe ranks Allston the most "up and coming" neighborhood, known for its nightlife, student population, diverse restaurants and bars, and hipster vibe. Allston is extremely walkable and our apartment is at the center of everything. Nearby hot spots include Great Scott, an Allston institution for comedy and live music every night,
neighborhood_overview: The Boston Globe ranks Allston the most "up and coming" neighborhood, known for its nightlife, student population, diverse restaurants and bars, and hipster vibe. Allston is extremely walkable and our apartment is at the center of everything. Nearby hot spots include Great Scott, an Allston institution for comedy and live music every night, as well as Seoul Soulongtang, an authentic spot for Korean food, served at traditional low-seated tables. Allston's restaurants cater to every taste, including an array of vegan and gluten-free options, and virtually every international cuisine.  We're also on the border of Brookline, ranked as the "best suburb in the nation" for its livability. Brookline is a historic neighborhood with small-town charm, including independently-owned bookstores, the art deco Coolidge Corner movie theater, and plenty of Jewish bakeries and Kosher delicatessens.
notes: NA
transit: Our apartment is immediately across from the B Green Line train and the 66 bus, which goes to Cambridge. The bus runs about every 10-15 minutes. The apartment is a 10 minute walk to Coolidge Corner and 15 minutes to Boston University's West Campus. It is also a 30 minute walk to Harvard Business School, and 40 minutes from Fenway.
access: You'll have private access to the entire apartment.
interaction: NA
house_rules: NA
host_about: I'm a masters student at Harvard studying global health. I'm also founding a non-profit in India that's scaling up text message reminders for moms to get their kids vaccinated. I'd describe myself as very extroverted and interested in hearing about other people but no pressure if you just need a bed to crash!

house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

For shopping, check out the Prudential Center
neighborhood_overview: There’s plenty to offer within walking distance. Head to Alden & Harlow for a creative New American fare and a cocktail on tap. Or try the lively Article 24 for a funky American cuisine, and enjoy live music while you dine. For shopping, check out the Prudential Center Boston shopping mall. To explore the rest of the city, head to the Boston Landing Commuter Rail Station just a short walk away. Located in the peaceful Lower Allston, you're an easy walk to Harvard Square and the Charles River. This neighborhood has quickly turned into a hotspot for travelers that enjoy an evening near Allston Village, while maintaining a desirable distance to the student nightlife. If you’re looking for something to do, we suggest snagging tickets to a game at the Harvard Athletic Complex just around the corner!

name: The magical TreeTop House: central and cozy
summary: Want to stay in a cosy private room with an amazing view in the middle of Boston? This is a great option! The neighborhood is full of life, yet safe and quiet. It's very central, right in the middle of Allston. Restaurants, cafes, bars, bakeries, grocery stores, public transportation (bus 66 to Harvard, 64 to MIT, B line to Downtown Boston), are all walking distance. The house has a wonderful energy which I think is the perfect complement to make your visit to Boston memorable! :)
space: This is a wonderful house in the middle of Boston, but it is located on the top of a little hill and is completely surrounded by trees. It has a beautiful porch and an outside table. The house has an amazing energy. It is a big house with 5 rooms and two bathrooms. We are six roommates: 2 scientific (1 postdoc/ 1 PhD), 1 cook, 1 baker, 1 dance teacher (Berklee), and 1 entrepreneur (MBA). It's as interesting as can be! During the time the house is available for rent there should be a period of time where all of them are going to be around (except me), other periods with probably just a couple of them, and other periods none. We all welcome you to our little community and we hope that you will enjoy Boston as much as we do! The bedroom is spacious (20ft by 13 feet) and has 2 closets. Common spaces include: Eat in kitchen, with a dishwasher and pantry, also with great views; 2 bathrooms, including one with a bathtub; Common living room with a movie projector, in-unit-free-Laundry, and the
description: Want to stay in a cosy private room with an amazing view in the middle of Boston? This is a great option! The neighborhood is full of life, yet safe and quiet. It's very central, right in the middle of Allston. Restaurants, cafes, bars, bakeries, grocery stores, public transportation (bus 66 to Harvard, 64 to MIT, B line to Downtown Boston), are all walking distance. The house has a wonderful energy which I think is the perfect complement to make your visit to Boston memorable! :) This is a wonderful house in the middle of Boston, but it is located on the top of a little hill and is completely surrounded by trees. It has a beautiful porch and an outside table. The house has an amazing energy. It is a big house with 5 rooms and two bathrooms. We are six roommates: 2 scientific (1 postdoc/ 1 PhD), 1 cook, 1 baker, 1 dance teacher (Berklee), and 1 entrepreneur (MBA). It's as interesting as can be! During the time the house is available for rent there should be a period of time where all o
neighborhood_overview: Allston is a vibrant neighborhood! Very diverse, international cuisine, bars, cafes, little shops, etc. Everything is walking distance!
notes: We are a community with a low-impact lifestyle, and are trying to be conscientious of our impact on the earth. This currently includes energy efficient heating, with fully insulated walls and roof, minimization of light usage, Environmentally friendly cleaning products, composting, recycling everything possible, low-flow faucets and toilets. We are also interested in learning about new ways to make a difference. If this sounds like an ideal living environment for you, then please come take a look!
transit: Public transportation: bus 66 to Harvard, 64 to MIT, and metro line B to Downtown Boston are all walking distance.
access: All of the common spaces of the house will be accesible. Laundry is available in the house (no cost).
interaction: I will be out of Boston travelling until mid-February, but will be available by email and phone call for any information during that time. My roommate Juan will be there to greet you and help you during your stay! My roommates are from diverse backgrounds and nationalities: Juan is from Ecuador and does his MBA at Babson College while launching his healthy beverage company, Leo is from France and does his PhD in computational biology at Harvard, Kristin is from New Jersey and is a dance teacher at Berklee, Josh is from Tennessee and is a cook (i.e he cooks amazing food at home!) and his partner Shala is from Indiana and is a baker (enjoy fresh bread)!

Our apartment is located on a quiet side street and is a quick skip, walk and hop to restaurants, bars, shopping and public transportation. Our neighborhood, Allston, has all the conveniences of city living without any of the city hustle and bustle!

name: Private Room in Luxury Apartment
summary: This is a beautiful modern apartment located right next to Harvard Business School. Walking distance to Harvard Square and public transportation.
space: A beautiful modern apartment with private bathroom and everything you need to have a comfortable and convenient stay.
description: This is a beautiful modern apartment located right next to Harvard Business School. Walking distance to Harvard Square and public transportation. A beautiful modern apartment with private bathroom and everything you need to have a comfortable and convenient stay. You have a private bathroom, access to the kitchen and space in the refrigerator. You can access the living room and even play the piano during reasonable hours but only if you are a pianist. There  is wifi and a Smart TV in the bed room. You can also access my iMac desktop. There is washer and dryer available in the apartment. Ideally I will like to meet you and greet you in person to show you around and explain how access to the amenities. The apartment is basically on Harvard campus. There is a super market downstairs and a Starbucks as well as other restaurants and bars.There's a large field/park next to the building and its very safe. There is a bus stop right on the corner of the building to get you into Harvard Square i
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is basically on Harvard campus. There is a super market downstairs and a Starbucks as well as other restaurants and bars.There's a large field/park next to the building and its very safe.
notes: This is my personal space so some of my belongings will be in drawers and in the closet etc.
transit: There is a bus stop right on the corner of the building to get you into Harvard Square if you are too cold to walk. It's a 2-3 minute bus ride. Or 10-12 minute walk.
access: You have a private bathroom, access to the kitchen and space in the refrigerator. You can access the living room and even play the piano during reasonable hours but only if you are a pianist. There  is wifi and a Smart TV in the bed room. You can also access my iMac desktop. There is washer and dryer available in the apartment.
interaction: Ideally I will like to meet you and greet you in person to show you around and explain how access to the amenities.
house_rules: - quiet hours 11pm-7am
host_about:
Recent Harvard Graduate class of 2018 :) Master of Finance 

I am very down to earth, very friendly and always happy to help in any way that I can to make your stay as comfortable as possible in any one of my properties. I am only a message away :).

I was born and raised in Elizabeth, NJ and know the area very well, this is where most of my listings are located 5 minutes from EWR Newark Liberty International Airport. 

At the moment I split my time between New Jersey and Boston, Massachusetts and focusing more on being an entrepreneur rather than finding work. I truly love the Airbnb concept and hope to have listings all over the world some day :). I also have a car rental business that works on a similar platform as Airbnb called TURO. 

I am very interested in all Asian cultures and love meeting people from that part of the world. I hope to live there some day.  My family is from Ecuador and I have double citizenship for United States and Ecuador.

name: HOMEY 2BR APT! 1 FullBath & 1Private Parking!
summary: Welcome! This is a renovated and incredibly well located basement apartment, we have 2 Bedrooms/1 Bathroom, we have an excellent location if you want to take the T or Bus,and we have free private parking behind the building! Great variety of restaurants, bars, shopping, coffee shops, pharmacies, and more are located in walking distance. No parties allowed! Regards, Jesús & Otto
space: This basement apartment has two bedrooms, the first one has a queen size bed, and the second one has a full size bed , also you can use the living room as another bedroom with one comfortable sofa bed in case you need it. We have a small but full equipped kitchen and one bathroom. name: First-floor room in beautiful Lower Allston house
summary: Welcome to Boston! Whatever may bring you here, this house is perfect for your needs. The close proximity to Harvard Square is ideal for getting anywhere in Boston with ease. Or, you can head over to downtown Allston to take in the unique cultural scene (bars, thrift shops, and Korean restaurants galore!). People from all backgrounds and walks of life are welcome here. I hope you enjoy staying here while I am away as much as I enjoy living here!
space: Medium-sized private bedroom on the first floor of a beautiful well-lit Lower Allston house. Kitchen is fully equipped. Living room has television and upright piano for communal use.

name: Newly Renovated Harvard Garden Studio
summary: Newly renovated with private entrance and en-suite bathroom. This garden level space is perfect if you're on a budget and desire privacy, comfort and cleanliness. Renovated using top-end finishes including Imported Spanish Tile flooring as well as many other high-end materials.  Enjoy peaceful slumbers on our new Gel Memory Foam mattresses and white linen sheets while enjoying cable TV and Netflix on SmartTV. Free on site parking available upon request at time of booking. Central AC & Heat.
space: Everything about the space is brand new - these rooms were constructed to host Airbnb guests and are designed for travelers seeking the comfort, convenience and cleanliness they would find in a hotel, but at a fraction of the price. This basement level room is equipped with a Smart TV, Wifi, Queen bed with Memory Foam mattress, coffee maker, mini fridge and private bath. There is no kitchen or access to cooking equipment, however there are so many takeout options in our immediate area that one can get food delivered from any number of restaurants in under an hour. Our home is a classic three-decker. We now do Airbnb on the 2nd floor and in these two basement bedrooms. The basement has a private entrance around the back of our home for added privacy.

neighborhood_overview: The Allston & Brighton neighborhood offers some of the best options in terms of restaurants and nightlife in all of Boston, while also only being only four miles from Boston Common, which is the center of Boston. The property is also 15 minutes drive from Logan Airport. Supermarket, Liquor Store, Starbucks, Pharmacy, Restaurants and Retail, Bus Transportation, and Train to Downtown Boston are within 5-10 minute walk. Neighborhood is safe and well lit. Also close to Harvard Business, New Balance, WGBH, Bruins and Celtics Training Facilities, Boston University and Boston College. Target, Home Depot, Best Buy, Marshalls, Home Goods less than a mile away.
notes: The room is located in the basement of our home but was recently constructed to the highest standard and meets all required building and safety codes. There are two similar rooms in our basement (each with their own bathroom) that share a private entrance from the rest of the house and common area foyer.  We are located in the Brighton neighborhood of Boston, 4 miles from Downtown. We are close to several buses and the Boston Landing train stop is right down the road, about a 5-minute walk. The Boston Landing inbound train goes to Fenway, Back Bay (Downtown) and South Station.  You can find a link to the train schedule by going to (Website hidden by Airbnb) and selecting the Worcester commuter train.
transit: We are a five minute walk from the Boston Landing Train Station which makes getting to Fenway Park, Back Bay or South Station quick and easy. At the end of my street there is bus service to Harvard & Central Square. If you have a car getting to Downtown Boston or points north, south or west of Boston are easily accessed by either the Mass Pike or Storrow Drive. Logan Airport is an easy 20 minute ride. Uber and Lyft are also readily available.
access: We offer coin operated laundry for guests to use. Off-street parking is available for free, however it must be reserved at the time of booking. Unrestricted street parking is available all weekend.  Mon-Friday 8am-6pm there is a loosely enforced 2-hour restriction on street parking without a resident sticker.
interaction: Someone is on site to help if needed
house_rules: Please be courteous of others in the home and refrain from loud noises after 9pm.
host_about: Kevin and Leigha live and work in Boston, Kevin is a lifelong resident of Boston.  Part of our business is property management so our properties are always well maintained and in the unlikely event a guest has an issue we are equipped to deal with whatever the issue is promptly and professionally.  We love our city and our neighborhood, we enjoy sharing our favorite places to eat and visit with guests. We enjoy traveling ourselves, our most recent adventures took us to Cuba and Ireland, as well as ski trips to Wyoming and Utah.

name: Architectural gem with convenience and quiet
summary: The design in the main part of the house was done by the architect  Paul Lukez whose unique style offers both modernity and warmth.  The house was featured in the Boston Globe Magazine. The works of master photographers hang throughout the house. By car you are >20 minutes from Cambridge, downtown Boston & all major universities and hospitals.  Inside you will feel like you are in the country.  The master bedroom and bath are on the first floor with 2 bedrooms each with a private bath upstairs
space: The house is on the Newton-Brighton line and most easily accessible from Newton.  All you can see from the main living space is trees. At the same time you are 1.2 miles from Exit 17 of the Mass Pike for easy access to the city.   There is a southerly exposure so the entire home is filled with light.   The kitchen is well equipped since the owner is a trained cook.  The pantry will be stocked and tenant will have access to herbs, spices and basic ingredients like olive oil, flour etc.   There is a small back yard that is accessible from sliding doors in the rear dining area and the den.  The yard will be maintained by gardeners. Weekly cleaning can be arranged.
