Memory foam mattress with electric positioning in the master bedroom. If the weather is nice you can sit on the front balcony off the front sunroom. There is a sunny enclosed back porch overlooking the yard.  We have a nice yard and beautiful patio you can use if you coordinate with downstairs tenants.  In t
neighborhood_overview: Oak square is an eclectic mix of families and young professionals.  There are some college students as well, mostly from BC.  It is close to Brighton Center and Allston, where there are great restaurants and a good bar scene but one of the quietest neighborhoods in Allston Brighton.
notes: Parking is always available in the street even at night.  No sticker required.  Easy buses down the street  to Allston (Harvard Business School and BU) Fenway,  Cambridge (Kendall Square, Central Square and Harvard Square). There are two flights of stairs to apartment so may not be best for those with health problems.  I have dogs and normally live in the apartment although this summer I am not there, so if dogs are a problem this may not be for you.
transit: Fifteen to twenty minutes to bc green line,(using a cut thru at the golf course),five minutes to buses and of course uber and lyft are very active and priced well in the area.
access: If the weather is nice you can sit on the front balcony off the front sunroom. There is a sunny enclosed back porch overlooking the yard.  We have a nice yard and beautiful patio you can use if you coordinate with downstairs tenants.  In the Spring and fall we are doing a lot of yard work so there will be some landscaping in progress
interaction: I am close by, for the most part.   This is a two family house and the tenants downstairs are available as well if you need anything.  One is my son so don’t be shy!  He can help and knows all the hot spots and best restaurants around.

Close to restaurants in Brookline’s Washington Square and Cleveland Circle, as well as the B, C, and D branches of the Green Line for easy access to all Boston has to offer. description: Sunny, charming, and clean studio apartment just steps from the marathon route! Close to restaurants in Brookline’s Washington Square and Cleveland Circle, as well as the B, C, and D branches of the Green Line for easy access to all Boston has to offer. Comfortable amenities include a Casper mattress and high-end linens to ensure a good night’s rest. City of Boston Registration Number: STR391497 I will be available by text, phone call or email before and during your stay. There is abundant street parking before 6pm. After 6pm, it becomes difficult to park, so I suggest taking Uber, Lyft or the C or D lines to go to dinner or out on the town, rather than taking your car. There are wonderful restaurants in Washington Square, which is just a half-mile east on Beacon Street. Burro Bar has excellent tacos, but a reservation is required. neighborhood_overview: NA
notes: Please be mindful of street-cleaning when parking during the week! I live on the Brighton side of the Brookline-Brighton border. Brookline does not allow street parking overnight, and Brookline Parking Enforcement tickets between 2-5 a.m.
transit: There is abundant street parking before 6pm. After 6pm, it becomes difficult to park, so I suggest taking Uber, Lyft or the C or D lines to go to dinner or out on the town, rather than taking your car. There are wonderful restaurants in Washington Square, which is just a half-mile east on Beacon Street. Burro Bar has excellent tacos, but a reservation is required. Barcelona is great for tapas and wine, while Publick House has one of the best beer and cider selections in Boston. My personal favorite is Stoked Pizza at the corner of Washington and Beacon. They have great local beers on tap and amazing wood-fired pizza. Grassona’s Italian has a delicious brunch on Saturday and Sunday after 10. Enjoy!
access: NA
interaction: I will be available by text, phone call or email before and during your stay.

Checkout: Please leave the sheets on the bed and pile the towels in the bathroom. Lock the apartment door and the first exterior door and leave the keys in the lockbox. Thank you!
host_about: I am history teacher living in Boston. I frequently travel with friends- we love to explore new cities!

Cute, cozy, and spacious 1 BR apartment in the heart of Brighton/Allston.  Bonus queen sofa bed in the living room for additional guests. Around the corner from great bars, restaurants, shops, and plenty of amenities. Laundry is located in the basement of building next door for $2.50/load for both washer and dryer. Feel free to text or call! Stone's throw from restaurants and shops on Harvard St. and Comm Ave. Walking distance to Coolidge Corner and Packard's Corner for more restaurants or the beautiful art deco Coolidge Corner Theater for a flick. name: Whole apt in Boston neighborhood of Brighton
summary: 700sq ft apartment in the Brighton neighborhood of Boston.  Dunkin' Donuts and 7-11 are within a few minutes walk.  House is on the MBTA bus route- less than a 1 min walk to stops-express buses to downtown.  20 min walk to the green line train at Boston College.  5 min car ride to Mass Pike I-90. Logan airport is a 25 minute ride. 20 min walk to the Charles  River.  Also within a few minutes walk or less are several restaurants.
space: Entire 700 sq ft apartment in a quiet multi-family home located in the Brighton neighborhood of Boston. To ensure that all guests/tenants are comfortable and have a pleasant experience, cooking food that leaves pungent odors is not allowed.  No cooking or frying of foods, oils or spices that are heavily aromatic.  Kitchen is for light cooking only.  If this rule is broken an additional fee of $100.00 will be charged for cleaning and airing out of the apartment.  Apt includes large entry way with a desk, 1 bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, dining area and living room. There are 2 queen sized beds, one a pull out sofa bed.  Mattresses are memory gel/foam.  Included is a 50 inch  ROKU tv, wi-fi, and Keurig.  Guests do not have access to the thermostat as it is set for the whole building.  Heat is on 24 hrs a day, 7 days a week.  The heat remains between 70-73 degrees.

house_rules: Please download the free Airbnb app for easy, accessible communication.  I will message you the address and entry instructions a couple days before you arrive. The keypad code will be sent separately. Thank you for booking with us.  House Rules ***A reminder: To ensure that all guests/tenants are comfortable and have a pleasant experience, cooking food that leaves pungent odors is not allowed.  No cooking or frying of foods, oils or spices that are heavily aromatic.  Kitchen is for light cooking only.  Please use the venting fan when cooking.  If this rule is broken an additional fee of $100.00 will be charged for cleaning and airing out of the apartment.***    Please, NO cars in the driveway at any time, even if just to load/unload car.  Spaces are rented and you may be towed. If an early check in is possible we will notify you on your check in date.  Otherwise, expect to check in at 3pm. Please be respectful of noise as there are other long-term tenants and guests in the building.
host_about: Our house is in a section of Boston called Brighton, which is 8 miles from the Boston Common. We love the city of Boston and have lived here for the past 25 years.

This neighborhood has quickly turned into a hotspot for travelers that enjoy an evening near Allston Village, while maintaining a desirable distance to the student nightlife. If you’re looking for something to do, we suggest snagging tickets to a game at the Harvard Athletic Complex just around the corner!
notes: Due to new development, you may encounter some construction that may be audible from your Sonder Monday - Friday from 7:30AM - 5:00PM. This Sonder has a shared patio that is open from 8AM - 10PM, but you'll have the rest of the apartment all to yourself!

house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

neighborhood_overview: Allston area, also known as "College Town"! Tons of great restaurants, coffee shops, convenience store, bank branch, gas station, etc. You can find everything you need within walking distance!
notes: NA
transit: As for the restaurants and bars, this is the right place! There are tons of restaurants and bars in Allston, which we call Korean Town, but not limited to Korean ones.  One of my favorites is Hammaru, a Korean restaurant serving large bone-in pork dishes with some traditional Korean appetizers. Highly recommend  to have a combo C for 5 guests!  Also, the Korean Garden Restaurant is heaven for BBQ lovers! And Dolphin Bay is one of the finest Tanwanese restaurants in Boston!  If you love fried chicken wings, there is also Bonchon on the list! Another personal favorite is Mala Restaurant! I'm from Southwest inland China and this one is absolutely better than most of Szechuan restaurants in Boston. More than that, there are Indian restaurant Punjab place and the best Hotpot in Boston, Shabu-zen.  Oh don't forget the bars, Sihouette Lounge and The Draft are two places I've been to most on weekends. After you wake up in the morning, Deep Ellum and Roast Beast will be good choices for Brunch.
access: Entire apartment. Feel free to use everything.
interaction: You can always contact me for long-term stay discount. I live 5 minutes away from the apartment. Let me know if anything is needed.
house_rules: - Quiet hours: 10pm-8am
host_about: I have been living in Boston for years since college and I love this city! That is the main reason why I want to share my wonderful experience in Boston to anyone who's visiting here! As a host I'm doing my best to ensure all guests are staying comfortably and get to know the local Bostoners' life. Don't hesitate to ask if you have any questions!

space: Very convenient location with lots of public transportation options very close and many highly rated restaurants and shops nearby. The full bathroom has provided towels, shampoo and body wash. Bedding is completely laundered after every guest. The apartment will be thoroughly cleaned prior to each guests stay. The kitchen is available for use and the dishwasher makes clean up easy. If you want to stow away your belongings and clothes, feel free to use the wardrobe in the room. There may be additional guests staying in the apartment during your stay which is great for meeting new people and networking. We never accept the guests with no verification or negative reviews from their previous hosts. Cleaning is priority for us and we expect from our guests to respect it.  Essentially, we offer guests the convenience of a guest house while providing the comfort of home.

name: Sonder | The Continuum | Quaint Studio + Gym
summary: Travel better with beautiful modern spaces and consistent service.  Self check-in, 24/7 text support, and locations in the coolest neighborhoods are just a few of the reasons Sonder is a better way to stay. Located in Lower Allston near Harvard Square, this Sonder offers ensuite laundry, expansive floor to ceiling windows, and a fully-equipped kitchen to cook a delicious meal.  It has all the essentials to make you feel at home. While staying here, take advantage of the building’s fitness room, shared lounging area, and outdoor grilling to enjoy some fresh air.

notes: This Sonder has a shared patio that is open from 8AM - 10PM, but you'll have the rest of the apartment all to yourself! Due to new development, you may encounter some construction that may be audible from your Sonder Monday - Friday from 7:30AM - 5:00PM.

access: NA
interaction: NA
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Sunny Allston Bedroom
summary: It's in a spacious single family home with 2 bathrooms. The room has 1 queen bed. We have a fully stocked kitchen that you can use and2 friendly cats!
space: We are are twograduate students who like to host and meet new people!
description: It's in a spacious single family home with 2 bathrooms. The room has 1 queen bed. We have a fully stocked kitchen that you can use and2 friendly cats! We are are twograduate students who like to host and meet new people! You will have full access to the living room, dining room, kitchen and bathrooms and will be able to use all the common appliances (TV, cooking ware etc.) We would love to tell you how to get around, restaurants that we like and things we like to do! Just ask! Usually we are home in the evenings and chat about our days. Sunday afternoon there is usually a barbecue that you are welcome to attend. We  live in quiet residential neighborhood (mostly houses not apartment complexes) and are a 3 min walk away from a grocery store. We are 10 min away from Central and Harvard square on the 70/70A and 66 and 86 buses!

There is easy access to everything in the City including popular restaurants, bars, and shops right down the street! The Condo is minutes to bus stops that will take you to Back Bay and the popular Downtown! Also, don't miss out on the opportunity to have a pool right in the backyard for the summer! This condo is perfect for small groups that want to enjoy the City on a budget!

name: Books, vinyls, plants & sunlight oh my!!!
summary: Welcome to our humble abode, nestled comfortably on the border of Allston/Brighton/Brookline with Fenway, Back Bay and Cambridge all less than a 15 minutes drive. We have a plethora of diverse restaurant/bars and cafes all within walking distance, as well as plenty of grocery stores.  If you are visiting Boston for a concert, game, or just for fun, we are in a great location to get just about anywhere in the city.
space: In the 10+ years of living in Boston, this is by far the most unique  apt ive lived in. Located on the  border of Allston/brighton brookline, this place is unlike many properties currently listed on the website. This is not a vacant rental unit with sterile furniture being repurposed for air bnb guest only. While the guest room is set up for your belongings, My partner and I share the second room, and the apt is decorated with plenty of art, books, vinyls and plants.  From the greek inspired decorative fireplace to the private porch tucked in the back, this place definitely has its charm. The living room  features our growing vinyl collection, tons of books,  HDTV with amazon firestick ( comes with HBO, Netflix and Hulu) our fooseball/air hockey table and plenty of seating. There is plenty to keep you busy in the apt, however for those who like to venture out, the neighborhood has plenty to offer. Harvard Ave which is home to food, shopping, cafes and bars, is only a 10 minute walk. We

neighborhood_overview: Our apt is located right on the border of Allston, Brighton, Brookline, right in between Boston University and Boston College. There is a wonderful nightlife scene allston with plenty of restaurants, bars and cafes all minutes walking from the apt our a a quick uber ride. Cambridge is right across the bridge, so those looking for quick access to Harvard or MIT, we are less than a 15 minute drive. Fenway is about 10 minutes driving, with the heart of the city only an additional 5 minutes away. We are located 5 minutes away from 2 public transportation stops, located on the green line which is east to access from the airport.
notes: NA
transit: While we dont have private parking, for guest looking for visitor parking, Please let us know in advance. There are two spot located across the street from the apt. We can reserve a space, as long as an adequate heads up is given.
access: Guest will have access to every room with the exception of the Master BR. We also have a grill located on site for guest use, upon request!
interaction: My partner and i live in the apt as well and are more than happy to provide any accommodations to make your trip more pleasant. Please don't hesitate to ask!

neighborhood_overview: Boston is Massachusetts’ capital and largest city. Founded in 1630, it’s one of the oldest cities in the U.S. The key role it played in the American Revolution is highlighted on the Freedom Trail, a 2.5-mile walking route of historic sites that tells the story of the nation’s founding. One stop, former meeting house Faneuil Hall, is a popular marketplace.Affluent Back Bay is a shopping and dining destination. Along Newbury Street, well-heeled locals frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses. Expansive Copley Square is flanked by 1800s landmarks Trinity Church and the Boston Public Library. Mansions dot the neighborhood’s tree-lined streets, many on Paris-inspired Commonwealth Avenue.The South End is a culturally rich neighborhood with restored Victorian row houses surrounding charming English-style squares. Its popular dining and drinking scene spans family-friendly bistros, trendy eateries, gay bars and low-key pubs. The

access: entire apartment
interaction: hands-off type of host but always available when needed
house_rules: - Strictly NO PARTY POLICY! Serious complaints of unruly behavior will unfortunately result in guests being asked to leave. - No shoes inside (请在屋内穿着拖鞋) - Quiet hours 10 pm - 8 am (安静时间10 pm - 8 am) - $20 fee if linen has non-removable stains ($20 无法清洗的床单或毛巾) - $100 for lost fob ($100 遗失电子大门钥匙) - $120 for lost garage opener ($120 遗失车库电子钥匙) - - If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full. - If apartment left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $30 for every extra hour of cleaning required.
host_about:
I'm a traveling globetrotter, real estate professional, homeowner, mother of a toddler, and also a neat freak.

I have being renting through Airbnb for 1.5 years, and really enjoyed hosting people from all walks of life. And I profoundly appreciate the extra income I was able to generate to pay for childcare. 

What differentiate me and other hosts on airbnb is: I truly care about a guest's experience especially when it comes to cleanliness and how easy it is to check in/out. I only use pure white linens and towels, and only hire the priciest/best cleaning crew in town. 

My units are priced 20% lower than other Airbnb's in the area, and at least 50% lower than surrounding hotels. Please be considerate when using AC and leave the apartment in a manageable condition to help me keep the cost low.

neighborhood_overview: Boston is Massachusetts’ capital and largest city. Founded in 1630, it’s one of the oldest cities in the U.S. The key role it played in the American Revolution is highlighted on the Freedom Trail, a 2.5-mile walking route of historic sites that tells the story of the nation’s founding. One stop, former meeting house Faneuil Hall, is a popular marketplace. - The sprawling Fenway-Kenmore area is home to baseball’s iconic Fenway Park, drawing huge crowds for Red Sox games. Student hangouts and buzzy restaurants are concentrated around Kenmore Square, and clubs and sports bars line Lansdowne Street. Renowned cultural institutions include the Museum of Fine Arts and quirky Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum. The rambling Back Bay Fens park has a rose garden and walking trails. - Cambridge is a city on the River Cam in eastern England, home to the prestigious University of Cambridge, dating to 1209. University colleges include King’s, famed for its choir and towering Gothic chapel, as well as T

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very quiet, but easy walk to the Charles River, Harvard Business School, several restaurants, bars and diners nearby, Havard Av where all the Korean and Chinese restaurants are 20 min walk.  Central Sq and Harvard Sq are easily accessible via Uber or public transportation (MBTA bus 70 and 86) on Western Av. where a lot of great restaurants are.  Boston city is accessible easily via Uber/Lyft or via Redline from Central Sq
notes: Anton (my roommate) and I will be around and we are available to answer any questions you might have about your stay or local area.
transit: The neighborhood is walking distance to Harvard Business School (15 mins walk), grocery stores (Star Market - 5 mins walk, Trader Joes - 10 mins walk, Stop & Shop - 15 mins walk), commuter rail (Boston Landing station - 15 mins walk), Pavement Coffeeshop (5 mins walk), access to MBTA bus 70 and 86 that goes to Harvard Square and Central Square in Cambridge.  Uber/Lyft is readily accessible.  15 min Uber ride to Boston downtown when there's no traffic.  During commute hours it is recommended to use the Commuter Rail mobile app and take the commuter rail to down town or go to Central Sq and hop on the Red Line to down town.

house_rules: - No shoes in the house - Usually after midnight we go to sleep - Please try to keep the place clean and when you leave please take good care of cleaning up as if it were your house and for future guests - If staying more than couple days, Friday is when trash and recycle pick ups happen and you need to move the garbage cans to the front of the street - Please be respectful to furniture and the walls in the house
host_about:
I am an MIT alum who's into technology, arts, music and travel.  I love to read, watch old movies, and cirque de soleil.  My favorite food are asian, spanish, and good mexican food.  Currently I am running a software company FineTune that focuses on educational software and particularly qualitative assessments at scale. 

My motto is to build beautiful things that last and if you have great ideas around that I am always open to discuss.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Brighton, in the northwest corner of the city. Sitting on the shores of the Charles River, it gives off a very welcoming vibe. Throughout its 400-year history, the area has seen many important changes and developments. Washington Street runs through the center and is lined with trees and small businesses. Home to many Boston University and Boston College students, young professionals, and families, Brighton offers a diverse and populated community. The many affordable pub and restaurant options make it ideal for spending a leisurely afternoon or a night out on the town.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.

name: Newly-Renovated 3BR near Harvard, BU and BC
summary: Newly-renovated 3-bedroom Boston apartment close to Harvard Square, Boston University (BU) and Boston College (BC). Two blocks from the Charles River. Easy access to anywhere in Boston. Cable with premium channels and fast Wi-fi included. Comes with brand-new modern kitchen and bathroom. Private entrance via Nest locks. Off-street parking available on request.
space: The  apartment is located in the Allston/Brighton neighborhood of Boston, which provides easy access to all parts of Boston and Cambridge via public transportation or Uber/Lyft.  You are less than a half mile to the Charles River with bike/running paths, parks and playgrounds, canoe and kayak rental and a  Boston Bluebikes (bike share) pick-up location. It's an extremely safe, residential neighborhood, but also has all the amenities you need in walking distance.  The apartment is in walking distance to coffee/bagel shop (Pavement Coffee), pizza /sub shop (Big Daddy's), restaurant and bar open until 2am (Article 24), grocery store and pharmacy (Star Market/Osco), Starbucks and more.
description: Newly-renovated 3-bedroom Boston apartment close to Harvard Square, Boston University (BU) and Boston College (BC). Two blocks from the Charles River. Easy access to anywhere in Boston. Cable with premium channels and fast Wi-fi included. Comes with brand-new modern kitchen and bathroom. Private entrance via Nest locks. Off-street parking available on request. The  apartment is located in the Allston/Brighton neighborhood of Boston, which provides easy access to all parts of Boston and Cambridge via public transportation or Uber/Lyft.  You are less than a half mile to the Charles River with bike/running paths, parks and playgrounds, canoe and kayak rental and a  Boston Bluebikes (bike share) pick-up location. It's an extremely safe, residential neighborhood, but also has all the amenities you need in walking distance.  The apartment is in walking distance to coffee/bagel shop (Pavement Coffee), pizza /sub shop (Big Daddy's), restaurant and bar open until 2am (Article 24), grocery store
neighborhood_overview: Allston/Brighton is an up-and-coming, conveniently located neighborhood of Boston. Be at Harvard/BC/BU in under 10 minutes. Get downtown in 15 minutes. Cute coffee shops, bars and restaurants in walking distance.
notes: NA
transit: We recommend Uber/Lyft during your stay. Get anywhere in Boston in ~15 minutes and <$15. Major bus lines (70/70A/86) on the corner. Close to Red and Green subway lines. Right along the Charles River. Quick access to the highway (Pike 90 and 95). Parking is permit-free on the weekends, and permits are only required on weekdays if your car is on the street for more than 2 hours between 10am and 4pm. 24/7 permit-free parking is also available nearby.
access: NA
interaction: We live in the apartment below and are available to help 24/7 if needed, but otherwise we give our guests all the privacy they want.

description: A very nice spacious bedroom (about 14 ft x 15 ft, 210 sqft) with private bath available in a quiet neighborhood in a newly built 3 bedroom townhouse. Easy access to Harvard and Central Square Cambridge.  Grab this bedroom while it's hot! This incredible room features large windows, lots of sun light, two closets. The townhouse also has a large living room, dining area, stylish kitchen with stainless appliances, sunny windows with washer, dryer and an off street private parking too! You are free to access all parts of the house except other bedrooms. Please leave the place as clean as you found it and be a good boy scout or girl scout. neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very quiet, but easy walk to the Charles River, Harvard Business School, several restaurants, bars and diners nearby, Havard Av where all the Korean and Chinese restaurants are 20 min walk.  Central Sq and Harvard Sq are easily accessible via Uber or public transportation (MBTA bus 70 and 86) on Western Av. where a lot of great restaurants are.  Boston city is accessible easily via Uber/Lyft or via Redline from Central Sq
notes: Anton (my roommate) and I will be around and we are available to answer any questions you might have about your stay or local area.
transit: The neighborhood is walking distance to Harvard Business School (15 mins walk), grocery stores (Star Market - 5 mins walk, Trader Joes - 10 mins walk, Stop & Shop - 15 mins walk), commuter rail (Boston Landing station - 15 mins walk), Pavement Coffeeshop (5 mins walk), access to MBTA bus 70 and 86 that goes to Harvard Square and Central Square in Cambridge.  Uber/Lyft is readily accessible.  15 min Uber ride to Boston downtown when there's no traffic.  During commute hours it is recommended to use the Commuter Rail mobile app and take the commuter rail to down town or go to Central Sq and hop on the Red Line to down town.
access: You are free to access all parts of the house except other bedrooms. Please leave the place as clean as you found it and be a good boy scout or girl scout.
interaction: I am available when needed and live upstairs.   Anton, my roommate will be your neighbor across door and also might be around to answer any questions you might have.  We did our Ph.D. together at MIT and he is friendly Canadian working in the software industry.  Feel free to say hi, but usually he will give you space and no need to mind his presence.
house_rules: - No shoes in the house - Usually after midnight we go to sleep - Please try to keep the place clean and when you leave please take good care of cleaning up as if it were your house and for future guests - If staying more than couple days, Friday is when trash and recycle pick ups happen and you need to move the garbage cans to the front of the street - Please be respectful to furniture and the walls in the house
host_about:
I am an MIT alum who's into technology, arts, music and travel.  I love to read, watch old movies, and cirque de soleil.  My favorite food are asian, spanish, and good mexican food.  Currently I am running a software company FineTune that focuses on educational software and particularly qualitative assessments at scale. 

My motto is to build beautiful things that last and if you have great ideas around that I am always open to discuss.

space: I'll be away traveling, so my home is all yours. Please make yourself comfortable because there's nothing like the added perk of feeling safe and cozy when you're away on vacation. It's a little more than a mile around, and there is a view of Boston's Hancock and Prudential Towers. There is parallel street parking for residents and a couple visitor spots as well, but make sure to double check the signage (Boston is tricky). Happy to help!

description: 位于安静的富人区,步行500米内有公园,环境非常优越｡ 房屋内带全套高档美式乡村风格家具,厨房包含冰箱,烤箱,灶台,微波炉等各种现代化设施｡ 房间内有洗衣机烘干机,无需与外人共享｡ 主卧有独立卫生间和超大私人衣帽间,有一张Queen size大床,书桌椅,单人沙发,书柜,壁炉｡ 卫生间有浴缸｡ 提供全新毛巾和床品｡ 主卧,主卧的私人卫生间和衣帽间,厨房,客厅,餐厅,储藏间等 距离Allston中心美食区步行10-15分钟,波士顿最繁华和安全的地区之一｡附近大学有波士顿大学,哈佛大学,波士顿学院,均有公共交通可直达｡ 步行1分钟可至No.57公交车站,15分钟直达BU中心校区,No.501公交车半小时内直达downtown 步行4分钟可至绿线地铁,直达BU.BC,20分钟可达到Backbay中心商业区 餐厨垃圾请倒入水槽,打开水并使用水槽边的搅拌机按钮进行粉碎｡ 可回收垃圾和其他垃圾请进行分类后再丢入室外垃圾桶｡垃圾桶在大门右边10米处 靠近庭院阳台的位置｡

name: Private bedroom in the coolest location in Boston
summary: My place is close to Boston University, Fenway, Kenmore square, Allston, Downtown Boston. This is a private bedroom in a simple apartment located on a quite street 1 min from Boston University, 1 min walk from public transportation, 5 min from Fenway/Kenmore, 10 min from Downtown and Harvard. Internet, and Netflix available. Have the best of both worlds: a quiet large modest home and fast access to the best of Boston and Cambridge. Open kitchen and refrigerator, central heat, washer.
space: This place is not for everyone. Upon booking, one of the cohosts will contact you to welcome you and give you directions for your self check in. You will follow instructions on how to find your room. Your room is equipped with a fan, large bed, a desk, and desk lamp. You will be sharing the living room, kitchen and bathrooms with other guests just like you. There are no locks to the bedrooms, or to the house doors, however the house is extremely safe and have an updated security system. There is a great backyard, and a beautiful patio.  So if you are ok with a private clean bedroom and don't mind sharing the common areas, this place is for you.

neighborhood_overview: When you start college in Boston, especially at BU or BC, you hear about Allston and its infamous house parties. It sounds like a magical land of freedom. This neighborhood has character and is filled with impressive street art that has been sponsored by the city to keep graffiti and “tagging” off the walls. We think this neighborhood is worth paying a visit to if you’re looking for something a little off the beaten path. A little hipster, yes, a little grungy, sure, but full of rich culture, cool cats, and great food of all types—especially all foods Asian. Its main streets are lined with places to sip, shop, shoot pool, and play old-school arcade games.
notes: Please note that we put a lot of effort and sweat in running this airbnb, and while this is a great gig, we would like you to have an unforgettable experience.
transit: It's one min walk from Harvard Avenue stop on the Green line.  Our apartment is located close to: - Boston University - Boston College - Harvard University - Fenway Park Together, Allston-Brighton comprises countless super-cool niches, whether you prefer playing late-night dive bar darts or sipping early morning coffee in movie-set worthy cafes.
access: As guests you have access to the kitchen where we ask you to use it to do light meals only. You have access to the living room and bathrooms.  While our rules of the house are pretty clear regarding respect and cleanliness, we ask you to tell us as soon as something bothers you in the common area. Sometimes we cannot control what other guests do in the sharing areas, but we will do our best to follow up on a timely manner. USA Taxes request will be sent through airbnb after the booking is over.
interaction: Akiki the primary hosts might come by from time to time to check on guests, however the major interaction will be with the cohost who will be there to answer your messages and make sure your experience is excellent.

neighborhood_overview: Our beautiful Brighton, also known as “Little Cambridge,” is nestled just outside the city and is surrounded with local bars and restaurants, like The Green Briar and Brighton Bodega. This neighborhood has a quaint community feel and is in a perfect location for campus visits to Boston College or Boston University. Head to Brookline for a variety of delicious restaurants (we recommend Bon Chon) or see an indie and art-house film at the Coolidge Corner Cinema. In addition, there's plenty to offer within walking distance. Cozy-up at Barcelona Wine Bar in Brookline and enjoy a delicious Spanish-inspired tapas. For a more lively environment, head to The Publick House and grab a drink from their extensive beer selection. You're also just steps away from the beautiful Chestnut Hill Reservoir, where you'll find a maintained path that's great for walking or jogging. Take a stroll over to the lovely Boston College campus & admire its renovated historic architecture or visit an Eagle football ga

host_about:
Hello,
Lenny here alongside my wife Brittany. We work together with a co-host to provide you everything you will need for an exceptional stay. My home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed WiFi, and kitchen & bath essentials. Every experience is one-of-a-kind, thanks to our unique spaces and neighborhood guides. We aim to provide you a 5 Star, home-away-from-home service during your stay with us. 

Enjoy your stay, and welcome to Boston!

space: The house is newly constructed (2008) in lower Allston. Layout of the apartment: Floor 1: Living Room, Dining Room, kitchen, half-bath Floor 2: 2 bedrooms, full bath Floor 3: extra large bedroom, full bath Lots of amenities include a washer and dryer on second floor (conveniently located next to bedrooms),  security alarm system, working gas fireplace, customized, build-in flat screen TV and modern style bamboo blinds.

name: Amazing location: Sunny room on the Green line
summary: Welcome to my cozy & sunny apartment in Brighton in a quiet & safe but amazingly located neighborhood: 3 minute walk from high quality grocery stores, delicious restaurants, and the Green Line T stop to Boston center. Walk up the hill for a view of Boston at night, or go for a longer walk into Brookline or Allston, connected by one of Boston's hippest shopping streets.
space: I offer a sunny & charming spare room for female guests (sorry men; it's just my personal comfort!) who are visiting Boston. On the property is a friendly cat, Aeneas, who will most likely curl up next to you while you watch Netflix or YouTube projected onto the wall. Because I live here full time, you can be prepared to find plenty of evidence of the academic life of a Boston PhD student! The neighborhood is incredibly convenient - get the green line into Boston center, take the bus across the river to get to Cambridge, or easily drive to Boston attractions. Parking can be tricky, but there is free parking available on our street if you arrive before residents get home from work (you do have to be very careful about parking on street cleaning days - read the signs very thoroughly!). I especially recommend that guests arrive before 5 pm for the best chance of finding free parking in the neighborhood. A reasonably priced parking garage is at St. Elizabeth's Hospital, about a 20 minute w

neighborhood_overview: With a small park right across from the apartment, there's no more relaxing way to spend the afternoon in the city. One of my favorite things to do is walk 10 minutes up the hill & get a view of Boston. If you're interested in this, let me know so you can borrow my hammock to take up with you! I'm also lucky to live 3 blocks away from a great (read: cheap!) diner, and some other tasty restaurants 5 minutes walking distance. With the grocery store just around the corner
notes: NA
transit: Getting into Boston proper couldn't be easier. Walk 3 minutes to the nearest T stop & hop on the Green Line for a direct train to Boston's downtown. Buses to Cambridge also leave from nearby. The proximity to Commonwealth Avenue makes driving into the city very easy, although public transportation is often more convenient in this city!

summary: A quiet, cozy and private room in a second floor condominium building across a pond  in a quiet and safe neighborhood,  wonderful for strolls.
space: The guest room has a large window, big closet, dresser/mirror, two night stands and desk with a chair, decorated in pastel colors with a great shared bathroom outside the room. Guests are welcome to sit at the living room if they wish.
description: A quiet, cozy and private room in a second floor condominium building across a pond  in a quiet and safe neighborhood,  wonderful for strolls. The guest room has a large window, big closet, dresser/mirror, two night stands and desk with a chair, decorated in pastel colors with a great shared bathroom outside the room. Guests are welcome to sit at the living room if they wish. I'll be here when you arrive to give you the key to your room. On Mondays and Fridays check-in time is at 7:00 pm.  All the other days check-in time is at 3:00 pm. In a radius of 5 miles you can find: Boston College (10 minute walk), Boston University (20 minutes away on the T),  Education First (EF) (8 minute walk),  St. Elizabeth Hospital (by bus 7 minutes), WGBH, and Boston Landing   This is a lovely corner of Brighton, housing young professionals, college students, and families. summary: Located in lower Allston within walking distance to coffee shops, grocery stores, restaurants, the Charles River, Harvard Square, Harvard Business School, Harvard University. Bus routes are easily accessible which will bring you all over the city.
space: NA
description: Located in lower Allston within walking distance to coffee shops, grocery stores, restaurants, the Charles River, Harvard Square, Harvard Business School, Harvard University. Bus routes are easily accessible which will bring you all over the city. I like to give guests their own space. This is a 2 family house, the private room is located on the first floor and I live on the second floor. I love living in this area because I have easy access to get all over the city. My house is located near Storrow Drive and the Mass Pike. There are various bus routes that run within walking distance of the house. Within walking distance you’ll find: Star Market, Trader Joe’s, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, McDonald’s, The Breakfast Club, Swissbakers, Our Fathers, Article 24, and Big Daddy’s. This area is very popular for Uber and Lift users. Easy access to bus numbers 66, 70, 70A, and 86.  Bus 66 and 86 bring you to the Red Line in Harvard Square which gives you access to all the other trains in the city.

summary: Fully-furnished charming, sunny and quiet 2-Bedroom apartment in the Allston Brookline area, in a quiet residential area. space: 2nd floor unit in a 3-story building. Very well maintained building. Laundry in basement. Off street private parking.

Nice living-room and dining room openings on a lovely spacious deck with amazing views of beautiful surroundings. 2nd floor unit in a 3-story building. Very well maintained building. name: Location! Beautiful 5 Bedroom 2.5 Bath, 2 Parking!
summary: Hello all, welcome to your home in Boston! We have a modern and cozy two-floor apartment, well located in a safe neighborhood in Allston/Boston area. Newly renovated 2,500 sq ft home with 5 bedroom and 2.5 bath. Super convenient location to Fenway Park, Boston University, Back Bay, Downtown Boston...almost anywhere you want to explore in Boston!
space: You have the entire apartment to yourself and of course we are ready to help if anytime you need us. Modern and cozy, very clean and welcoming space with 1 king-size,  4 new queen-size beds. Extra pullout sofa bed in living room. The two-floor apartment is located on the first floor+garden level of a traditional three-family house. The unit is recently renovated. Cable and Internet ready! Samsung smart TV with Netflix, Youtube, Amazon etc. Lots of windows for fresh air and natural sunlight. We do deep cleaning after every guests' visit to make you feel just as comfortable as home.
description: Hello all, welcome to your home in Boston! We have a modern and cozy two-floor apartment, well located in a safe neighborhood in Allston/Boston area. Newly renovated 2,500 sq ft home with 5 bedroom and 2.5 bath. Super convenient location to Fenway Park, Boston University, Back Bay, Downtown Boston...almost anywhere you want to explore in Boston! You have the entire apartment to yourself and of course we are ready to help if anytime you need us. Modern and cozy, very clean and welcoming space with 1 king-size,  4 new queen-size beds. Extra pullout sofa bed in living room. The two-floor apartment is located on the first floor+garden level of a traditional three-family house. The unit is recently renovated. Cable and Internet ready! Samsung smart TV with Netflix, Youtube, Amazon etc. Lots of windows for fresh air and natural sunlight. We do deep cleaning after every guests' visit to make you feel just as comfortable as home. 2,500sf 5 bedroom 2.5 bath apartment, including two laundry room
neighborhood_overview: Very safe and convenient. Great location, 3min walk to the new Boston Landing commuter rail station, 12min walk to green line T, less than a mile to Harvard Business School, quick direct buses to Boston University campus, Fenway, Kenmore, Downtown Boston, Central Square, Harvard Square and more. There are dozens of restaurants, cafes, bars, dessert shops, and milk tea bars within 10min walk. Super Stop&Shop, Home Goods are steps away, New Balance flag ship store and their new gym are just 0.3 miles from the house!
notes: Exclusive access to the whole apartment. Two parking spots are at the back lot of the house.
transit: Boston Landing Commuter Rail Station (0.1 miles) (*only runs on commuter schedule, check on MBTA site or ask host for train PDF schedule*, $2.25 to Fenway Park Red Sox -Back Bay- South Station)  Allston St T station green line (0.6 miles)  Logan Airport (7.7 miles, take I90, 12min to 24min depends on traffic)  Direct buses or quick Uber rides to: Harvard Business School (1 mile)  Harvard University (1.6 miles, bus 66)  Boston University (1.2 miles, bus 57)  Also within 10-15min drive to Back Bay, Downtown areas taking I90 down the street)  Grocery stores: Super Stop&Shop (0.1 miles Everett St)  Star Market (0.7 miles Western Ave)  Trader Joe's (0.9 miles North Harvard St) Fave Restaurants, Bars, and Cafes Nearby (too many to count, seriously!): Lone Star Tacos (0.1 miles) The Glenville Stops (0.5 miles) The Daily Catch Seafood (0.8 miles)  Lulu’s Allston (0.1 miles)  Deep Ellum (0.1 miles) La Befana Pizzeria (0.1 miles)  Flatbread Pizza and Bowling (0.3 miles)  Roxy’s Grilled Cheese (0
access: 2,500sf 5 bedroom 2.5 bath apartment, including two laundry rooms in unit, 2 kitchens and 2 free guest parking spots at the back lot of the house!
interaction: My husband and I live not far from the property and available to help when you need us!
house_rules: Shoes off is preferred, slippers are provided on the shoe shelf (back door) and inside the house.
host_about: We love traveling and getting to see the world and meet new friends. We live in Boston and love this city! If you ever stay in Boston you are welcome to check out our listing and we want to be the best hosts for you. Aside from work, we like to dine and wine, travel, hangout with friends, work out and do outdoor activities.

interaction: We are always available as a concierge for advice and assistance to make your Boston Experience the best, both inside the house and in advising you of the most fascinating destinations in this amazing city. Please feel free to break the ice and introduce yourself. We would love to know more about you and what brings you here to this city. Hopefully Airbnb will be a start of a new friendship.
house_rules: Dear guest please follow the house rules, it is important for us to keep our house clean and comfortable for every one. 1- no shoes at home ( feel free to bring ur own sleeper)  2- no smoking at home or at the garden  3- no extra electric Heaters or other things inside the room with out host permission. 4- please give us call one hour before reaching to our place, call or message both is fine. It is important for us as host to know the exactly arrival time of our guests. 5- no extra guest over night with out host permission. 6- please wash your dishes and clean the stove after using the kitchen, it is very import for us to respect all the guests at home  7- do not leave the hair inside the bathroom, shower, bathtub, leave the rest room and bathroom clean after use  8- you will have to share bathrooms with other guests, if you are not comfortable sharing the bathrooms with others please DO NOT BOOK this room.  9- some people who have sensitive ears might find it little bit noisy at nigh
host_about:
I am an architect. I am fortunate to work/study full time between great cities such as Miami, Boston, New York, Providence, Istanbul & Baku. Airbnb is a side gig. Some places are very basic, others are of great value. My places are for people traveling on a budget. I have great cohosts that will take care of you in case I am not available. I love to travel, and connect with people. This account is professionally managed. 
 
 Life Moto: 
 “We are all travelers in this world. From the sweet grass to the packing house, birth till death, we travel between the eternities.”

name: 1BR 1Bath behind Harvard Business School
summary: Modern luxury apartment just behind Harvard Innovation Lab and Harvard Business School.
space: You are renting a private bedroom and private bathroom in Two bedroom and Two bathrooms apartment. Kitchen and Living room is common spaces. summary: 暑期短租】2B1B 超干净apartment, 卧室短租,招室友,男女不限｡ 【入住时间】5.15左右-8.25(希望可以包月整租) 【房租】转租900刀/月,水电网气全包 【房间情况】采光好,房间宽敞,暖气充足｡ 【房间设施】卧室内包含基本生活家居,如单人床,学习桌,衣架,椅子,柜子等等,房顶有顶灯,屋内含有落地灯｡厨房设备齐全,包括冰箱,烤箱｡客厅包含一个饭桌和四把椅子｡地下室有洗衣机和烘干机,非常方便｡ 【室友】室友是Tulane博士生,爱干净,平常作息规律,安静｡ 【位置&交通】126 warrent st, Brighton 位于BU和BC的中间位置,无论去哪个学校都很方便｡出家门走路一分钟到绿线Warren st站,半夜回家非常安全｡地铁10min到附近最大的中国88超市和star超市,20分钟到BU West｡临近Allston美食城,附近各种中餐 美餐 日餐 韩餐 奶茶应有尽有｡ 可加 (Hidden by Airbnb) 沟通:Duan (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  备注“租房”

notes: Breakfast is not included, but there’s a big kitchen with all you need to cook. Such as the toaster, microwave, oven, pans, instant pot, rice cooker, refrigerator, dish washer and all the cutleries you’ll need, and so on. You can feel free to use all of them. Also, the supermarket is just 2 mins walk away from the apartment. So it won’t be a problem to get yourself anything you need. :)  It is a very modern, new( only 2 years so no rat!!), clean, and eco-friendly apartment. The WiFi and central air-conditioning are also included. There are in-unit laundry, mail room, trash room and a lounge on the B floor. My place is on the 6th floor. There are also two elevators so you don’t have to climb stairs!

name: Lake Shore Modern Condo & Pool!
summary: Garden view from living room. Comfortable, modern apartment with all the amenities you need. Very safe neighborhood. Perfect location - feels like a suburb but only a 4 min walk to BC T-stop, Dunkin, convenience store, Mexican & pizza restaurant and more. Walk 7 min other way to Brighton Center to find Starbucks, CVS, restaurants, bakeries, convenience stores as well an express bus to Boston. Close drive to Brookline (hospitals), Cambridge/Harvard Sq, Newton and Watertown... You'll love it!
space: Apartment remodeled for a modern look. Two bedrooms have queen beds; third bedroom has a full size sofa bed. Very comfortable with all the kitchen amenities you could ask for (even a waffle iron and espresso machine!).  Cable, high speed internet available (as well as a printer). Assigned parking spot in the parking lot.

name: Renovated One Bedroom Apartment Allston, MA.
summary: A stunning apartment on the first floor of a Victorian house built in 1890. The apartment offers: a renovated kitchen, 1.5 bathrooms, a  Master bedroom, full livingroom, Front porch with patio chairs, driveway with free off-street parking. The master bedroom includes a smart tv and a walk in closet.   In the living room you will find  a twin sized trundle bed, smart tv,/WiFi and an electronic fireplace.  Eat in kitchen  with refrigerator, dishwasher, disposer, microwave, and a  gas stove.

space: There is a common area with microwave, fridge and coffee maker.
description: WiFi and Large TV with Netflix and Hulu! A block from public transportation to schools/ down town.  Restaurants and convenient stores nearby. There is a common area with microwave, fridge and coffee maker. There is NO kitchen use allowed but there is a common area and your own private bedroom. I’m a friendly person but I will give you space :) We are in prime location for the T. Uber rides are abundant and cheap since we are pretty close to everything. Just a single train ride into Boston! PARKING ON WARREN ST: Park at 6PM you will be good until 10AM. We live in the city so after about 7-8pm it is very difficult to park and it will be up to you. NEXT BEST PARKING IS ON HARVARD AVE, then take the train up and down, use as last resort! We are on the 4th floor but it makes it easier to look at the city through the window! ** Do NOT use the AIr Conditioner ($20) **

name: Master Bedroom w/ Private Bathroom Great Location
summary: This is the spacious master bedroom with a TV and private bathroom in a 3 bedroom apartment. The apartment has fully equipped kitchen and even a hot tub. Entire place is designed for the comfort of Airbnb guests. Super easy self check-in/checkout. In 5 mins walking radius you'll find the best collection of Brookline's restaurants, cafes, nightlife and shopping. Easy access to public transportation awaits you as this is the heart of everything. Questions before booking? No problem, just e-mail!
space: Very convenient location with lots of public transportation options very close and many highly rated restaurants and shops nearby. The full bathroom has provided towels, shampoo and body wash. Bedding is completely laundered after every guest.  The full bathroom  has provided towels, shampoo and body wash. The apartment will be thoroughly cleaned prior to each guests stay. The kitchen is available for use and the dishwasher makes clean up easy. If you want to stow away your belongings and clothes, feel free to use the wardrobe in the room. There may be additional guests staying in the apartment during your stay which is great for meeting new people and networking. We never accept the guests with no verification or negative reviews from their previous hosts. Cleaning is priority for us and we expect from our guests to respect it.  Essentially, we offer guests the convenience of a guest house while providing the comfort of home.

name: Cozy, convenient & private room in heart of Boston
summary: My place is close to Boston University, Fenway, Kenmore square, Allston, Downtown Boston. This is a private bedroom in a simple apartment located on a quite street 1 min from Boston University, 1 min walk from public transportation, 5 min from Fenway/Kenmore, 10 min from Downtown and Harvard. Internet, and Netflix available. Have the best of both worlds: a quiet large modest home and fast access to the best of Boston and Cambridge. Open kitchen and refrigerator, central heat, washer.
space: This place is not for everyone. Upon booking, one of the cohosts will contact you to welcome you and give you directions for your self check in. You will follow instructions on how to find your room. Your room is equipped with a fan, large bed, a desk, and desk lamp. You will be sharing the living room, kitchen and bathrooms with other guests just like you. There are no locks to the bedrooms, or to the house doors, however the house is extremely safe and have an updated security system. There is a great backyard, and a beautiful patio.  So if you are ok with a private clean bedroom and don't mind sharing the common areas, this place is for you.

There are no locks to the bedrooms, or to the house doors, however the house is extremely safe and have an updated security system. There is a great ba
neighborhood_overview: When you start college in Boston, especially at BU or BC, you hear about Allston and its infamous house parties. It sounds like a magical land of freedom. This neighborhood has character and is filled with impressive street art that has been sponsored by the city to keep graffiti and “tagging” off the walls. We think this neighborhood is worth paying a visit to if you’re looking for something a little off the beaten path. A little hipster, yes, a little grungy, sure, but full of rich culture, cool cats, and great food of all types—especially all foods Asian. Its main streets are lined with places to sip, shop, shoot pool, and play old-school arcade games.
notes: Please note that we put a lot of effort and sweat in running this airbnb, and while this is a great gig, we would like you to have an unforgettable experience.
transit: It's one min walk from Harvard Avenue stop on the Green line.  Our apartment is located close to: - Boston University - Boston College - Harvard University - Fenway Park Together, Allston-Brighton comprises countless super-cool niches, whether you prefer playing late-night dive bar darts or sipping early morning coffee in movie-set worthy cafes.
access: As guests you have access to the kitchen where we ask you to use it to do light meals only. You have access to the living room and bathrooms.  While our rules of the house are pretty clear regarding respect and cleanliness, we ask you to tell us as soon as something bothers you in the common area. Sometimes we cannot control what other guests do in the sharing areas, but we will do our best to follow up on a timely manner. USA Taxes request will be sent through airbnb after the booking is over.
interaction: The major interaction will be with the cohost who will be there to answer your messages and make sure your experience is excellent.
house_rules: - 1. Quiet hours in the shared areas are from 10 pm to 7 am - 2. No shoes in the house - 3. Communication of arrival time is a must, and double confirming with the host through the airbnb messaging platform about the readiness of your room is a MUST. Please any show ups to the appartment that is not scheduled will be treated as a violation. - 4. Check out is at 9 am. This is important because the cleaning team needs to come to fix the room for the next guest. Kindly respect that.  - 5. There are extra fees with additional non booked guests.  - 6. There are no keys to the room or doors but we have safe boxes to store your valuables. - 7. We do have a flexible check in but this means that guests can leave their luggages in the common area while waiting for the previous guest to check out (usually at 9 am) and the cleaning team to clean the room. We want to make it so smooth for the guests, and we would appreciate your cooperation on informing us about your schedule, and we will do our du

neighborhood_overview: Look up Allston Village, you will get enormous info about the area. It is very close to Harvard, MIT, Boston University by bus, biking, or walking. There are plenty of bars/restaurants where you can go to.
notes: Please pick up after yourself and keep toilet seats closed.  Closest prepared fresh food, very affordable: BAZAAR International food store on Cambridge street. I highly recommend it. Download app "HERE we go"and it works without internet connection with any sim card. It is helpful to find places.
transit: Get your Charley card at the airport T-stop (if available) or Harvard T-station. If you are staying at least 3 weeks, charge it with monthly pass, or put some money on it right there at the machine. The plastic Charlie card gives you discounts to some stores, and to the MBTA and one free transfer with every ride. Read about it online before you come. The bus fair is less than train, so when you pay for the bus and transfer to the train, it will add the money difference. Buses are 3-5 min walk away. 66, 64, 57. Please look up (URL HIDDEN) (Metro Boston Transportation Authority and use TRIP PLANNER from Hano street. Take pictures of local maps and make them available off line before you arrive as your phone may not work here or in case there is no internet connection. Consider bike rental idea. Bring backpack and and reusable light weight nylon shopping bags. Avoid bringing plastic shopping bags into the house please. Emergency call 911, Boston information/Mayor's hot line call 311
access: The room is warm but there are always extra blankets. Also, if you need different pillow, if mattress is too soft or too hard, just ask, I will help find the solution. Microwave, refrigerator/freezer (shared). Cooking is not possible, sorry. Laundry service is available at $10 per load
interaction: If I am traveling, I will inform you. At that time, please email or use (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) or (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) to call me if it's urgent. Direct cell phone line will not be available.
house_rules: Guest must be a non-smoker (no vapor either) Cologne/perfume use not allowed due to allergy Clean bathroom after yourself: remove your hair from the shower and sink, use mop to wipe off water from floor if you left any, wipe off toothpaste from sink and faucet if you left any, keep toilet spotless clean (use brush if needed) No disturbance of any kind Please do not use speaker phone anywhere in the house Please use headphones when making calls from your laptop Be polite with other guests  Guest agrees not to give this address for mailing to anyone without permission in writing, especially a bank, credit card, magazine subscription, and when donating to any organization. Failure to do so will result in find of $200 paid prior to departure (I will explain the reason) Guest agrees to separate his trash: recycle all plastic, paper, metal into provided bags Guest must inform the host if there are any changes in arrival time Please limit your stuff to 1-2 suitcases (ask if in doubt) There is

summary: Comfortable, spacious and clean bedroom in a 2 bedroom apartment. Perfect for visitors to Boston or Boston College students. Excellent access to public transportation as the building is very close to 3 different Tram Stations! One is right in front of the building, the other one is 5 mins walking distance (Cleveland Circle) were you'll also find grocery stores, restaurants, cafes and nightlife. And only 10 min walking to Reservoir Station, from here you can get to the city in 20 min.
space: The bedroom is very bright and spacious, has a doble bed, desk and storage space. Common room has a kitchen and dining table, all available for your use. The Bathroom is shared but only with one more person that stays there very occasionally. The building has a laundry room that you can use.

name: Studio on Commonwealth Ave in Brighton
summary: I love this studio because it is located in front of the T station and close to bus lines. It is convenient located near bars, restaurants, shopping stores, Starbucks or Dunkin Donuts, and groceries: Whole Foods and Star Market. 10 minutes from Boston College and  Boston University. Located 15 minutes from Harvard University. 20 minutes to downtown Boston on the T and 10 minute car ride.
space: My wonderful studio is located in front of the Greenline T Stop. This studio is great for students or working professionals. Great public transportation close to train and busses. Uber/Lyft gets here within 1-3 minutes! The studio has great lighting as it has a skylight in the ceiling. There is a queen size bed that has blackout curtains to block the skylight at night for a comfortable and restful night sleep.

Please contact me if you have questions or concerns. Neighborhood is safe and it has a lovely night life 10 minute walk from the apt. This apt is close to everything you can possibly need for you
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is safe and it has a lovely night life 10 minute walk from the apt. This apt is close to everything you can possibly need for your Boston stay.
notes: NA
transit: There is no parking available and most of the street parking is residential only. The B green line is right in front of the building it goes to Boston College, Boston University, and the rest of Boston. The 66 bus goes to Harvard/Cambridge. 57 bus goes from Watertown to Fenway/Kenmore! 65 bus goes to Brookline. Ubers/Lyfts get here within 1-3 minutes, so be ready to leave immediately.
access: NA
interaction: Please contact me if you have questions or concerns.
house_rules: House Rules 1. Use the back door in parking lot for in and out of building.  2. No shoes in the house slippers/flipflops ok 3. No smoking of any kind 4. Do not climb or sleep on bunk bed  5. No loud music or parties  6. Turn off Central Air when out of the apt 7. Turn off all lights when out of the apt 8. Load the dishwasher before checkout 9. Do not use pool -- pool is not free 10. Do not park in the parking lot car will get towed.  11. Take keys at all times because there is no locksmith  12. Take all your belongings because the host is not responsible for lost behind items. 13. Please if anyone asks say you are visiting a friend -- not likely it will happen. 14. Keep apt in mint condition any mess out of ordinary Airbnb use will be charged extra.
host_about: I’m originally from Boston. I travel for real estate work, and I study full-time online  for my bachelors degree in psychology. I stay a lot in upstate NY with my boyfriend and my dog.

summary: Beautiful renovated, 2 Family home, lower floor. 2 Large size bedrooms +  Living room.  Quiet neighborhood, bus access to many locations.
space: NA
description: Beautiful renovated, 2 Family home, lower floor. 2 Large size bedrooms +  Living room.  Quiet neighborhood, bus access to many locations. We are not far away, available for you 24/7 Stop and shop near by, restaurants and bars less then 5 min walk. Small and quiet neighborhood Right on train station to the city, few minutes walk to the train and you in the heart of Boston within few minutes With respect to parking, in the area directly outside the house, Hano Street requires permit parking after 2 hours. The beginning of Hano (by the Walgreens) has no permit restrictions and the surrounding streets do not require a permit. You can park on Penniman Street (directly parallel to Hano) Braintree Street (perpendicular to Hano) or Cambridge Street (one street further parallel). Just be sure to check for  street sweeping signs and no parking signs.  Most guests park their car a block away and then leave it for the duration of the trip in order to avoid expensive parking downtown.

name: Private Basement Floor in a Modern Apartment
summary: Beautiful 4 bedrooms, 3 bath apartments located in Allston. The apartment is brand new construction and located half a mile away from Harvard Business School Campus. The unit includes: dishwasher, laundry/dryer in unit, gas stove, new refrigerator, central heating and AC, two decks (one on the ground floor and one on the roof), and plenty of closet and storage space. The unit includes a parking spot and is close to public transportation and Trader Joes.
space: The space is organized in three floors with the basement floor with private room, closet and full-bath. The garden floor has kitchen, outdoor patio, living room and dining room. The entire second floor is a bedroom with a private den and a full bathroom. The third floor has two bedrooms with a shared full bathroom. The fourth floor is an outdoor deck with seating.

name: Beautiful room - a few ft from the green line!
summary: This cozy environment is perfect for getting your quiet time and rest between Boston adventures! A quick walk to the Green Line (smack dab between the B and C rails in Brighton.) Two other rooms in the unit are occupied by BC students Mary and Emily- they are cool as a cucumber and happy to share the communal space with visitors!
space: The bedroom is very large and sunlit. There’s a desk and comfy desk chair, an extremely comfortable full size bed, and a MUJI bean bag. The kitchen, living room, and bathroom are all small scale, but include everything needed to be comfortable!
description: This cozy environment is perfect for getting your quiet time and rest between Boston adventures! A quick walk to the Green Line (smack dab between the B and C rails in Brighton.) Two other rooms in the unit are occupied by BC students Mary and Emily- they are cool as a cucumber and happy to share the communal space with visitors! The bedroom is very large and sunlit. There’s a desk and comfy desk chair, an extremely comfortable full size bed, and a MUJI bean bag. The kitchen, living room, and bathroom are all small scale, but include everything needed to be comfortable! neighborhood_overview: Cleveland Circle (Starbucks, Chipotle, CVS, 7/11) ; 10 minute walk to Whole Foods on Washington St. The green line (B and C)
notes: The apartment is 100% 420 friendly. There is a grinder I keep on the bedside table which you are welcome to use for your 420 needs.
transit: There is free parking available very close on Commonwealth Ave that usually  fills up by 5pm. Green line, Uber, or bicycle/blue bike are also good options.
access: There is laundry on the first floor (I have a card with money on it and I accept (Hidden by Airbnb) transfers for the use of it. The unit is on the third floor and includes 3 bedrooms,  a communal room, a bathroom, and a kitchen with dining space. Two of the bedrooms are occupied by BC students.
interaction: I work often in the center of Boston as a pedicab driver. If you are in anywhere between Fenway and the Seaport and would like a pedicab ride or a tour to see the city like you’ve never seen it before, you can message me and I’ll let set you up with a ride! Other than that, I’ll be living at my boyfriend’s in another part of Brighton, so I’m available if you need help. My roommates are also able to help you out with whatever questions you may have!

name: A Bright and Comfortable Private Bedroom+Bathroom
summary: Greetings! We are a friendly Chinese family (my husband, my daughter, and me) hosting people from different cultures in our nice apartment.  Our apartment is about 10 mins walk from the T station-Boston College. It has a big living room, an open dinning room and a kitchen, three bedrooms, and 1.5 bathrooms. We offer the guest room for airbnb hosting. Our home is safe, clean, and comfortable. Your room is private and has a lock. You can use a private full bathroom.

Our apartment is about 10 mins walk from the T station-Boston College. It has a big living room, an open dinning room and a kitchen, three bedrooms, and 1.5 bathrooms. We offer the guest room for airbnb hosting. Our home is safe, clean, and comfortable. Your room is private and has a lock. You can use a private full bathroom. name: Spacious Newly Renovated - Close to Public Transit
summary: Just Renovated and in a great location! This apartment is close to Boston University, Coolidge Corner, Fenway Park, Paradise Rock Club, and Agganis Arena. There's easy access to all of Boston via the train and bus routes. My place is close to Harvard Business School, Boston University, Harvard University, Green Line, Red Line, and bus.
space: There are 3 Queen beds in total so this space is great for a group visitng Boston looking for accomodations close to the city at a more affordable cost. There are tons of restaurants close by and Back Bay or Downtown are just 10 minutes away. There is also a bus stop around the corner that goes into Fenway every ten minutes.
